Reviews.Title: “Windward Pointe needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Lindakoz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 8th stay at Hyatt Windward Pointe and we were very disappointed with the suite this time. It is in need of updating as the interior is looking very worn,tired and a bit shabby. Our suite also had some kind of biting bug and I got bit severly the first 2 nights there, it seemded as though the critters were in the vicinty of the sofa and /or carpet. We used our own bug spray (we ALWAYS have it with us on vacation) and that seemed to get rid of the biters. I Never got bit outside, though! The grounds and pool area of Hyatt Windward Pointe were meticulous and beautiful as always. The bus line was convenient and low cost and the airport right next door, also very convenient! The Abbey Road snack shack was a great addition, and made it so you never have to leave the place unless you want to...and the food was good quality and value. The staff very nice, however, the housekeeping services left a lot to be desired as far as what they refer to as a "tidy up". We probably have stayed our last stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bluebird09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt Windward Pointe with three girlfriends for five nights the last week of February. Our unit was tastefully appointed and quiet. We loved the large patio, although the sliding glass door was often difficult to slide open. The pool area was just lovely. Daily housekeeping came as an added bonus but erratic times. The concierge was most helpful. We did hear the airplanes but this was not bothersome nor often, Water pressure in showers could have been better. The beds and even the sofa bed were comfortable. This is truly a beautiful, serene resort!

Reviews.Title: “Another Week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Vickie
Reviews.Content: Of all the Hyatts in Key West (four properties), this one is the most spacious and relaxing. Beautiful well kept grounds and pool area. Large two bedroom condos with everything you need. We'd love to live here. The staff is always professional, friendly and responsive and a tribute to the great management team in charge there. Can't wait until our next visit. It's just so relaxing sitting by the pool and looking at the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Key West retreat outside of town”
Reviews.Author: mdcruiser2011
Reviews.Content: I spent a very enjoyable week at the Hyatt Windward Pointe resort. It is four miles outside of town, and overlooks the seawalk and Atlantic Ocean. Even though the road is right outside, the magnificent view of the ocean and the beautiful landscaping at the resort make you forget it. The airport is extremely convenient (a five minute walk) and it would be possible to stay there without a car, since the local bus stops right outside the resort. There is also a shuttle service into the Old Town Hyatt Hotel for $5 per person, each way. The two bedroom units are beautifully decorated and very comfortable, with a spacious balcony with an ocean view ... we ate our meals and spent our time there! The pictures on the website are 100% accurate!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nipssa
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) helpful and efficient staff. 2) lovely pool and hot tub. 3) carefully landscaped grounds. 4) fully equipped, comfortable apartments with spacious decks. Pretty much this adds up to a "5." What keeps it from a 5? 1) no quality cafe on-site. There is a cafe by the pool but it is little more than a hot-dog stand. 2) the landscapers turn out at 8 AM with leaf blowers, trimmers, lawn mowers, the works. You can forget about enjoying breakfast on your deck on the days when your "area" is targeted. Fortunately, they seem to rotate. Others have complained about the airplane noise. We (on the ocean side) had little problem with this. You will see and hear the occasional commercial jet, and you will see and hear a lot of bi-planes (pretty charming!). But you will see more F18s than all of these combined, and that is true for all of Key West. The property is about 3 miles from the chaos of Duval Street. If you are 18, you will think this too far; if you are 40+, you will find it a relief. I would certainly recommend Hyatt Windward Pointe to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: TtravelerJohn
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for 5 years. Great place and not too far out. Can't say I noticed the airport noise but I did notice the Navy noise. When those jets go overhead you can't miss them. Fortunately only during the day and certainly not too often. The resort is clean and very well kept. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. And there is a very nice Italian restaurant next door. Stayed 2 weeks this year and cna't wait to come return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: BRLArgentina
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 2 kids in Feb 2012. The rooms are big and nice. The pool is beautiful, and the service excelent. The only con is that you have to leave the hotel at 10:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “a nice visit”
Reviews.Author: WarmweatherHeather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt with another couple for three nights. The property is well maintained and clean. We didn't notice the airplane noise from inside our unit and the flights don't really take off early in the morning or later at night so it shouldn't bother sleep. Windward pointe has a shuttle system that is $5 per person to take guests around the island. All of the tourist attractions are about a 5- 10 minute drive from the property. This is a great property if you're traveling with friends or a family with kids. For a family, the location gets you away from the insanity of Duval. For friends or couples, its great because you have two bedrooms a large living room and kitchen for cheaper than two hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Patloves2travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spectacular! Beautifully decorated, large balcony with telescopes. Great furniture with rocking chairs. Well appointed kitchen. Staff sets up barbecue grills with charcoal tells you which one is yours. Daily garbage pick up and towel exchange. Also low pressure to take take a timeshare presentation.

Reviews.Title: “a week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: haryoungsr
Reviews.Content: We flew down on my friends private plane which was a new experience for my wife and I. We flew into Key West airport which was 1/8 of a mile from the Hyatt. It was a beautiful flight and a wonderful time in Key West. the hotel was so clean and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. They helped us rent bikes for the entire week we were there,in fact the bikes were delivered to the hotel and picked up at the hotel when we left. Quite reasonable also.We did not rent a car but rode everywhere we wanted to on bikes ,it is flat and bike friendly area. Many fine restaurants,like The La tratoria,close to this hyatt,the restaurant in the Hyatt by the area everyone goes to watch the sun go down,an interesting experience at Blue Heaven or was it Blue Moon. We also went to a small island for lunch and beach one day .It was across the bay(?) from the Hyatt and Mariott again where folks go by the hundreds to watch the sun go down.The Hotel has a small kitchen so we bought food and prepared breakfasts and some lunches,snacks etc in it . We also grilled out one night ,the hotels grills were reserved by us a day in advance and lit by the Hyatt staff at the designated time. Checking in and out was easy. The room cleaners were polite and accommodating to our daily schedule. The washer and dryer. were a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Lots of great qualities but still comes up short.”
Reviews.Author: ole7
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons and I recently stayed at this property. We usually prefer the condo/timeshare properties because of the space. This property is definitely a plus in that respect. The kitchen, bedrooms and bathrooms are all spacious. The added laundry and huge balcony is definitely a plus when travelling with kids. The property being situated next to the airport should not be taken lightly. We knew about the aiport before we arrived. A little noise doesn't typically bother us and the kids like seeing planes take off. BUT, the noise is really loud. Not little propeller planes but fairly large jets taking off over your room starting at 6:00 A.M. You get used to it after a while but smell of jet fuel is just awful. We couldn't sit on the balcony or by the pool on several days because the wind was blowing the jet fuel smell over us constantly. The rooms are also starting to show some wear and housekeeping could definitely be better. Thick dust on the toliet paper holders, chunks of tile missing, dishwasher with missing parts, dirty couch, fridge that was covered in sticky stuff, a microwave that needed to be wiped down, a shower with the slowest drain ever. Plus, the most unfriendly front desk staff. We checked in the evening and the person at the front desk was very rude. Sighed and was clearly put out when I said we were checking in. I'm not sure what the problem was but I felt like I was being rude for checking in. The location was a plus. It is definitely out of old town which we prefered with the kids. We loved visiting old town but liked that we could escape in the evenings. It is obviously easier to park and get around in new town. There are also several grocery stores down the street which made getting food easier. There is also a great pizza place close by (Mr. Z's) which delivers pizza to the property. Benihanna's is also next door. Overall, I just didn't think the amount added up to quality. I would probably try another place next time I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “The resort makes you feel like your a resident of Key West”
Reviews.Author: JGF357
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is a time share property and that I normally prefer Hotel/Resorts. These 2 bedroom condos all have large balconies and ocean views. The balconics have wonderful tables to have breakfast or lunch at while enjoying the ocean view. They also have 2 rocking chairs which I sat in for hours while I smoked a cigar and watched the boats go by. The rooms are very spacious. The master bedroom has a gorgous private bathroom with dual sinks, a shower and seprate jacuzzi tub. The guest bedroom was decent size and had a guest bathroom with a tub/shower across the hall. The kitchen area was beautiful with granite countertops and you could also see the ocean from the kitchen area which was nice. They have a washer and dryer in your condo but i found it to be very noisy so I would not use it at night. The furniture was comfortable and stylish. The grounds were beautifully kept and we loved the infinity pool. There was also a outdoor hot tub but unfortunately they were repairing that during our stay. They have a food shack which makes cocktails and serves grilled food. The food and drinks were good and reasonably priced. You could bring your own drinks and food if you like to the pool but no glass bottles were allowed. The staff was friendly and helpful which is what you expect from a Hyatt property. The concierge arranged for any reservations we needed. Plus by staying here you had full access to the Hyatt Hotel located just off Duval street. Meals, drinks etc could all be charged back to your room at Hyatt Windward Pointe. The only negative my wife found was that it was not on the beach. Smathers beach is the largest beach in Key West and its about a mile walk down the Blvd. We usually drove down since there was never problem finding parking but the walk was nice to do during the sunset hours. Hope you enjoy your trip to the Keys whereever you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Windward Pointe Review”
Reviews.Author: Penny R
Reviews.Content: The property was very nice with a beautiful 2-bedroom suite. A few things were a bit annoying. First, it's nice being near the airport (literally in walking distance) but being that close is VERY noisy. Second, we had asked about shuttle service and was told there was a shuttle that could take us to the Hyatt sister property down in the pier area/Duval street. What they neglected to mention was the $5 per person fee each way, so it cost our party of five $50 for a round-trip ride and calling/getting shuttle was a pain so we went ahead with car after a day of this. We assumed shuttle to a sister property would be complimentary. Vendors come on MOndays to sell their tours and services and this was useful to hear about them all and decide what to do for the week, as well as chance to win free tours in raffle. The little sandwich shop on property doesn't have much in the way of food options, but makes great pina coladas, mudslides, margaritas, etc. and 2 for 1 from 3-6pm. Overall, a nice place to stay but transportation should be planned ahead -- you will definitely want a car.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, but probably our last...”
Reviews.Author: stevertr
Reviews.Content: Some things are a real challenge with any property. Others are deceptively easy and simple. Other reviewers have eloquently told about the property itself. The rooms are huge, with 2BR suites, 2 baths, full kitchen, and a gorgeous balcony overlooking the ocean. The property faces a few main challenges: 1. The property sits essentially on the runway for Key West airport, and the noise from the planes taking off is deafening. Of course, we already knew that, and were willing to deal with the planes in exchange for having a great room that was double the size, for less money, than it was to stay on the busy side of the island. 2. The rooms and property were at one point really nice, but are starting to get pretty tired. Things falling off like the toilet paper holders, a toilet that only flushes if you hold it down, a kitchen that's aging which isn't being helped when you arrive and the burners aren't connected on the electric stove. It just really needs a little bit of a facelift. 3. The worst part of the property, and probably the reason I won't be back, is the landscaping. Not the lack of it, by the way, but the care of it. We came to Key West to relax. We want some time to sit on the balcony, sip mimosas in the morning, and put the cares of the real world behind us. Instead, the landscaping crew has already begun its operation with gas powered blowers, hedge clippers, weed wackers that simply DO NOT STOP ALL DAY!!!! Read my lips Hyatt, when I'm by the pool relaxing, the 1 inch unevenness in the height of the hedge wasn't bothering me!!!! I literally was forced to leave the pool each day because I was angered to the point of a visceral response hearing the engines start up. I'm by no means a violent person, but if I thought I could take him, I would have grabbed the [--] blower out of this guys hands, and thrown it in the ocean. Forget about the gorgeous balcony, because you physically can't even hear yourself thing. I know I'm not the only reviewer to mention this. Tip for Hyatt - Buy a broom, a set of manual hedge clippers, and maybe, just maybe, a cordless electric silent blower and you'll retain far more guests. Thanks to Andre and Lisa at the front desk for being among the best people we've encountered!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean view!”
Reviews.Author: Mbyford
Reviews.Content: The close proximity to the airport is great for arrival and departure. You can literally walk to/from the airport. The hotel grounds are beautifully maintained and it. Ever seemed crowded in spite of being sold out. My only complaint is that the housekeeping folks don't seem to have a system in place to insure all rooms are cleaned daily, as I had to request cleaning 2 of the 6 days that we stayed. Great for a relaxing Key West vacation away from Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Robert Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and didnt want to leave, we had a 2 br condo, it had everything you could possibly need, from a stereo in the LR flat screens in the br. private master bath and a guest bath, very cool telescope for looking out to sea, nice saltwater pool and jacuzzi. Right next to the Key West airport but dont worry we didnt hear a thing from the planes. The beach is directly across the street.This is a top quality resort at the quiet end of the island away from the crazy partiers on Duval Street but, thats just a 5 min drive to get there or do like we did take your bicycles and ride all over the island and party all you want on Duval Street with no worries. It was a great time and we will be returning again this coming summer. Price was around 220.00 per night but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort if it only had a beach”
Reviews.Author: lscott
Reviews.Content: We had 2nd floor unit in bldg#2 overlooking pool and ocean. 2BR/2baths. Beautifully landscaped, well maintained with lots of nooks to sit in swing, hammock or chairs. Pool does not seem child friendly (but we saw no children, mostly retired folks.). Lovely pair of iguanas! Plenty of lounge chairs. Margarita party with raffle one PM, wine tasting another day. We attended breakfast with vendors and prizes Mon.AM. Many water sports and bike tour; at our age we do not speedboat or snorkel but we did take the Wine &Wind 2-hr sailboat cruise at sunset. It was one of the most memorable things we have done on vacations. Beautiful weather most of week, smooth water. Unit was very roomy for the 2 of us. Master BR:king bed, lots of pillows, the usual hot heavy annoying duvet that we replaced with blanket, safe, plenty of hangers. Nice color scheme throughout, not just plain white walls. Master bath 2 sinks and whirlpool tub, lots of lighting and counter space. Kitchen: full refrig, dishwasher, microwave, good quality dishes. Trash removal and towels replaced daily. Living room w/sofa, chairs, large dining table w/chairs. TVs in 3 rooms. Very nice large balcony, glass top table, 4 wicker padded chairs plus 2 rocking chairs. Husb said this would be perfect resort if it was only on a sandy beach. Smathers Beach is about a mile down the road. We walked it one morning, looked nice. Longer and wider than looks from road but sea is so calm that we were not tempted to use beach. Martello East museum a short walk from resort. Watch out for Robert The Haunted Doll. He gets his own citations from presidents and mail. Don't mess with him.We took discounted tickets for 3 museums( Lighthouse next to Hemingway House and Art museum on Front St )and enjoyed all very much. Parking in Old Town a problem. We parked on side streets with long long walks to the front, used a lot of change on parking meter a long walk away, and once with an appointment pending we pd$ 20 to park. Duval St and the pier areas are fun to shop and sight see. We dined at Trattoria next to resort twice, very good. Benihana is next to it. Maint issues were minor, personnel all helpful and courteous. Airport noise was no problem whatever, in fact we enjoyed seeing the variety of planes and jets from Navy base. We flew into St Lauderdale, rented car because we wanted experience of driving thru Keys. OK once but drive back on Fri PM was hectic. If there is next time, we will fly into Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spasco
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Hyatt and we could not have been more pleased with our decision to stay at this location. The rooms were more spacious than we had expected, the staff could not have been more helpful and the room were extremely clean. We would highly recommend staying at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place To Stay In Key West”
Reviews.Author: YoungGun382
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe from 11-12 to 11-19 and had an amazing time. We were greeted warmly at the front desk and after check-in we were directed to the concierge where we met Lynn who was tremdously helpful. She gave us information about small events the Hyatt was having for the week and gave us information about things to do while in Key West. She booked us a wind and wine sunset sail, a kayak and snorkel excursion, and bicycles for the week. We saw her almost every day around the resort somewhere and she always checked to make sure we were having a good time and if we wanted to do anything else. The Hyatt had a welcome breakfast on Monday where local vendors came and gave us information about fishing, biking, snorkling, sailing, etc and gave away a few prizes. We got 20% off from a lot of places if we mentioned we were staying at the Hyatt. They also had a margarita party at the pool one afternoon and hosted a wine tasting in the lobby as well. Once again, you could win door prizes and it was nice to meet other guests staying at the Hyatt. The room was great and we made breakfast most mornings in the kitchen and ate on the porch overlooking the grounds and ocean. Our room was cleaned daily and towels changed out everday as well. The grounds at the Hyatt Windward Pointe are spectacular. Other than the garden we saw at one of the Old Martello Forts, the grounds here were the nicest on the island. We biked to the Southernmost Point, Hemmingway House, and Lighthouse in about 15 - 20 minutes at a leisurely pace. The Hyatt had free parking so we spent our money parking downtown. It was maybe a 5-10 minute drive and we always enjoyed coming back to the "quite side" of the island to relax after the craziness of Duval St. The pool was very nice and we were able to swim almost every day. There are a couple of iguanas that hang out there and they are neat to watch. The hot tub was nice especially if it was cloudy or later in the evening. There were ample spots to soak up the sun and we saw people using the grills even though we didn't cook on them. The Abbey Road snack bar had a ping pong table and a pool table and there were two shuffleboards behind it. I'll address some issues I've read on here: Airport Noise: It's not like Key West is a major air traffic hub and we only heard one or two planes from inside our room. It was enjoyable to watch the small planes and even the few larger ones while at the pool. Key West is not that big and we acutally heard as much plane noise while at other places. Distance to Duval St.: Like I said earlier, it's a great place to get away from the crowds and relax, but it's not like it's 30 minutes away. It's a 5-10 min drive. You could ride bicycles to the heart of Duval in less than 25 minutes and just have a cab pick you up. Scooters seemed to be the way to go if you want to save the money on parking. The only negatives we encountered were the Abbey Road snack bar didn't have fish for their fish sandwiches all week. I spoke to the Abbey Road mgr and he said he was having trouble finding a good fresh fish for an affordable price. I understand that you want to serve a quality product at an affordable price, but just cover it up on the menu if you don't have a supplier. We were disappointed by this. They did have great hamburgers though. The only other thing was that my wife got bit up by some bug at the pool. It wasn't mosquitoes, but some small gnat looking bug. You might want to wear something to prevent this. Overall, the Hyatt Windward Pointe was the perfect choice for our stay in Key West and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Long Awaited...Relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: ThatGirl_77627
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Tuesday till Saturday and LOVED the resort... We enjoyed being a little away from all the action, but were only a quick 4 or 5 minute drive to Duval St. We had an issue with our coffee pot and once we called it took about 5 minutes and they were up at our room with a new one. Very accommodating. The grounds were kept up and beautiful. They do start working outside on the grounds early in the morning, but I see that as a bonus. It was beautiful. We enjoyed the different themes they had each night... We had a wine night, a margarita day at the pool, etc. It was very relaxing. The rooms are wonderful and spacious. We had a great view of the beach and pool area. Volleyball court was right outside our room. We will be back for sure. My only complaint is that my pillow was a little flat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms Right off the Runway”
Reviews.Author: J0sRad
Reviews.Content: The parking lot at the Windward Point in literally 10 yards from the end of the runway at the Key West Regional Airport. Our two bedroom condo was quite nice with a view of the ocean. It was on the front of the building so, while we weren't subject to every takeoff and landing we, when a larger plane was preparing for takeoff, the room shook - not pleasant at 7AM. Rooms nearer the back of the property must be in the jet wash. No beach, decent pool and a dismal snack shop/bar. I would stay here again only if they had the last room in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A nice get away”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last weekend and liked it very much. Beautifully appointed rooms with huge balcony overlooking tropical landscaping and the beach. Parking in old town Key West can be problematic so if you plan on going back and forth you might be happier at a B & B downtown. We liked being a little out of the way and although the property backs up to the airport our room location kept us from being bothered by noise. If you like jogging or walking, the beach has a very long esplanade that is perfect. Housekeeping was fine and we had a 2 bedroom 2 bath unit that was perfect for the three of us. We had a very nice dinner at La Trattoria which is next door and within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bug bites, lousy basic hotel services, ugly iguanas at pool!”
Reviews.Author: iulianasirobert
Reviews.Content: Very poor hotel services - had to call several times a day to get maid service. Basic items not restocked. Complaints to manager had little affect. Ugly iguanas all over pool and spa area. Pool was not heated and cold. Staff dumped chlorine into pool system while we were in spa which immediately overwhelmed spa water with bleach smell. No onsite security - complained about a man who was using the spa ( shaving in spa) who was not staging at resort and solicited guests for front money for gambling scam. For business travelers, hotel front desk and coffee service was not available in early morning. We had stayed at beachside hyatt in kw in spring which was much better managed. Airport is very close and pretty large planes take off and land right on top of the resort - building shake and noise is evident inside rooms. A holiday inn is capable of providing consistent basic housekeeping services at much lower rates. Poolside chips margarita party was lame. Will not return. Advertised fed/military government rate is much higher than federal per diem rate for KW during period. Parking is free but resort fee more than makes up for this as I can't see what other benefits I am getting for my resort fee here.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Cottagelady579
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. We have a nice view of the ocean and the amazing pool. The condo has two bedrooms and two baths with a well equipped kitchen and lovely balcony/porch. It was reasonably priced and convenient to Old Town Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: PA_Mom_0f_2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long "girls' weekend" with 5 girlfriends of mine. The Hyatt was absolutely perfect! We slept easily in the two bedroom, two bathroom villa (we took turns sleeping on the pull-out sofa) and we had plenty of room to relax and to get ready. Our villa had a nice view of the ocean (albeit across the street of A1A) and the grounds were impeccable. The front desk and concierge were remarkable and very friendly. The Hyatt is located next to the airport, but the occasional plane that flew overhead was not too bothersome. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who may not want to be right on top of everything; taxis and shuttles were able to get us down to the action on Duval Street very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten”
Reviews.Author: Tammy H
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and appears to be well maintained. Our unit appeared to be very clean when we checked in. The staff was also professional and helpful. Here is the problem. I got eaten by some type of bug in the unit. My legs have no less than 100 bites, my arms more than 30. Since we had torrential rains while there, we knew these bites were not mosquito bites. I've contacted Hyatt to make them aware. All I can say is I've been living on Benadryl since I got home, and I am trying to prevent any kind of infection. Be cautious if you stay here. Not sure what kind of bugs bit me, but there were definitely bugs in the unit, seen or unseen.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NavigatorChick
Reviews.Content: We stayed last year and it was a great place to stay. We especially loved Abbey Road and their happy hour! The pool was great too!

Reviews.Title: “nestled snugly between the ocean and the airport runway!”
Reviews.Author: JJ565
Reviews.Content: There are things that name Hyatt implies, staff telling guests to go to Key West and get wasted, rooms unavailable before 4pm, ( even in off season, with the hotel half empty) rooms shaking every time an aircraft taxis for take off, loud rock music by the pool, and the view from the infinity edge pool, interrupted by used plastic glasses and trucks thundering along the road that separates the hotel pool area from the ocean......... are not amongst them!!!! However this was our experience of this Hyatt, and it is not one we will be repeating. Our room did have a wow factor, the place was spotless, although the list of articles in the room was not complete, so if you do stay make sure you check the list left for you, don't plan on sleeping in, if the aircraft noise isn't enough the gardeners vacuum the footpaths every morning at 8am. The hotel is at least 4 miles from the centre of Key West, I'm certain there are better nearer places to choose to stay. My advice don't bother with this timeshare resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family stay: clean, upscale, comfortable, safe”
Reviews.Author: rrr1079
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the beautiful 2-bdr suite, granite kitchen coutertops, beautiful furnishings, huge outdoor veranda w/ rattan patio table, chairs. Safe, family-style, not crowded, didn't notice planes, great view of Atlantic, easy to travel around island. My Mom and sister said "nicest place they've ever stayed". It was great decor , clean, and best layout for my family. The beds were AWESOME, clean and o-so comfy. I slept like a baby. My neice loved it, toop. The pool was massive, and lots of fun in evening. The outside grill should have stayed open late for travelers coming back to hotel for the day. Parking was good & free. The landscape on the entire grounds was absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet timeshare in a good location”
Reviews.Author: CruisingtoRetirement
Reviews.Content: We were there in August 2011 just before Hurricane Irene decided to pass the Keys and swamp the East Coast. Let's deal with the primary complaint people have with this venue, its proximity to the airport. You could walk from the terminal building to the hotel but the taxi it only $4.00. Yes, you hear the airplanes especially if you are out in the parking lot or by the pool. No, we did not find them annoying. However, the jets going into the naval air station were loud enough that you could probably hear them half way to Marathon and everywhere on the island. My only other complaint was that the barbecue grills which used charcoal are in an awkward location. So, that is the total of my negative things to day about the place before I go give an otherwise glowing review. It is a very nice place. The staff was attentive and the rooms are large. It is a time share so you get the full kitchen and amenities expected of a time share. The telescope is a nice touch. We were in building four on the second floor. The view was excellent. The pool is large enough to accommodate the people that were there the days we used it. It was clean and well maintained. The grounds are pretty and exhibit nice tropical flowers. You can't walk there from Duval street, so if you are looking for the noise and "action" of the city's legendary night life, this may not be the place, but to my way of thinking, that is a good thing. I don't want loud parties next door late into the evening. I enjoy a place as quiet as this. You can't walk to the beach, but Smather's beach is not far away. We did nto swim there since the weather kicked up by Hurricane Irene made the waters too rough, but the beach looked nice. We ate at La Trattoria next door twice, I will post a separate review shortly. I hope to return when the weather is a little cooler. CTR

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lindavoner
Reviews.Content: We where in Key West for the first time and could not have picked a better place to stay. From check-in to all our needs during our trip. The staff was amazing and helped us at every turn. I would especially like to thank Jeff at the front desk for all his assistance. When Hurricane Irene changed our departure plans he was very helpful and it felt as if we had a friend at the Hyatt. The hotel was on the quiet side of the island, but I prefer that. We flew into Miami and drove the overseas highway which was a beautiful ride. The hotel was beautiful and very spacious for 6 people. The condo had everything we needed and more. If you needed anything all you had to do was call and that item appeared at your door within minutes. The grounds where great especially the pool and hot tub. Happy hour was enjoyable daily before heading out for dinner. Must see on Key West is Duval Street, Mallory Square, Hemingway museum, Truman white house ( if you like history), sunset cruises, snorkeling. Many fabulous restaurants to choose from. All in all a GREAT vacation. Would recommend Hyatt Windward Pointe HIGHLY.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best of service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: TSH51150
Reviews.Content: From the elite and well trained staff to Abby Road (the cookery by the pool) everything was excellent. The service,the food, the amenities absolutely first class. We are going back next month and we can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Property Amenities-Staff--All 5 Star=Best Vacation in years”
Reviews.Author: 10shezam
Reviews.Content: This property is on the quiet side of Key West. This means you travel 15 minutes (by electric car) to the Mallory Square Destinations but also when you are back you have a quiet relaxing scenario to enjoy. The pool and Abbey Lane Snack shop are in a lush green setting with ocean views of speed boats, jet skies, sailing yachts and fishing boats passing for constant entertainment, The rooms are 2 bedroom suites with laundry, kitchens and wonderful King and Queen size beds. The patios are spacious and offer many options for relaxing and enjoying quiet time. Nice privacy for both bedrooms.The master suite offers a Jacuzzi tub,(my favorite) separate shower and well lit mirrors. The beds are comfortable (really comfortable) the kitchen is simply stocked with pans dishes etc detergent etc; you only need the food. A large dining table and living area gives great air conditioned comfort. From the check-in with the friendly capable reception staff to the late night support staff, everyone we met were wonderful. We checked in, received the room we requested, sat with the concierge and were updated on all the many options available to make our stay memorable. Discounts and recommendations were given, (we also checked with the locals) and truly enjoyed the activities and restaurants, Any requests we made were handled quickly and completely. But the true test of staff is in an emergency and we had a medical emergency. The response was quick and profound. Not only did they respond with professional emergency measures but were supportive and consistant in supplying whatever was neeeded to make the patient most comfortable and assuring those involved that whatever was needed to make this situation less difficult to master was provided. Thank you to Jeff and Lisa in particular. You represented Hyatt in the most professional way possible. Even with this situation, this vacation was the best we've had in a long time. Look for a quick return we love this property!

Reviews.Title: “We were satisfied with the accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherTan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 6 nights and it was nice. It was less crowded than Duvall Street so you could get away from all the people, the parking or taxing in town could be expensive but you could find reasonable if you looked. Pool was nice, grilled the lobster we caught at the poolside grills. Overall great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: tmtip
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a wonderful relaxing week at the Hyatt Windward Pointe in Key West. I can't say enough about this resort, everything was great. The location is right across from the Atlantic Ocean with beautiful views right from our room which we never got tired of. The grounds were spotless . The pool was amazing with the most beautiful views of the ocean. Each day at the pool we would get a visit from the "hugh" local iguanas that lived in the trees next to the pool. They were very interesting to watch. The snack bar, "Abby Road" served hot food and had a nice happy hour but it does close too early, 6:00PM. The room was excellent, very clean and spacious. We did not cook in the unit but the kitchen was stocked with everything that you would need. We really enjoyed using the telescope that was provided in each room. We would place it on the hugh outside porch and watch the boats that would pass by. We can't wait to return to Key West and also Windward Pointe!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dianenh888
Reviews.Content: Took my 2 sons and their friends as a graduation gift from high school and college. The 2 bedroom condo was fantastic. The kitchen was the best for 4 grown boys to cook and always have food on hand. A expected surprise was the washer and dryer in the unit. That was the best. The location was also fantastic. It had the most incredible views and was far enough away from the Duval Street area to make the location quiet. I rented a bike for the week and road all around the island each morning. The bike rental delivered my bike and picked it up at the hotel. I would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort/property. We're been there before and we'll return”
Reviews.Author: zmagman
Reviews.Content: Key West is not known for it's beaches or mega resorts. The Hyatt is a lovely property which is not in the midst of the hustle and bustle of downtown Duval Street. It is a beautiful resort and one of the gems of Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “You get A LOT for your money!”
Reviews.Author: beckaroo8
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this place! We are repeat customers of this resort every year. There is not a bad view from any room! When we first researched staying here on Trip Advisor many people seemed to be bothered by the airplane traffic from the nearby Key West airport. Honestly, I don't even think I even noticed any noise during this last trip. The first year we stayed it was so cool laying out by the pool watching the 747's full of Key West tourists arriving to one of the most tropical places in Florida. We enjoyed the fun poolside drinks, guys played shuffle board/ping pong and there are many grills if you want to do a dine in evening. Benihana's is next door and all the Duval Street action is just minutes away from Hyatt Winward Pointe. The hotel is super clean, spacious enough for two couples to share and beds VERY comfy as well. Can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “arriving tomorrow and totally confused but mostly worried”
Reviews.Author: timesharepa
Reviews.Content: So... we booked the Windward over the winter through Interval. We were very excited because it's not easy to find a property in Key West that is available for a two week period. WE have always wanted to travel to the Keys and were looking forward to total relaxation. In the past, when I have booked through Interval (mostly Marriot properties), I have called to request a room on the top floor and close to the pool. I have NEVER been disappointed with the way Marriot has treated me. Our request was honored each and every time. UNTIL NOW. For the first time, we booked a Hyatt property. As we have done in the past, we researched the property, called and requested the unit we most wanted. We were told there was no one scheduled to be in that particular unit and that they would note our request -- that it SHOULD NOT be a problem. We called several times to check on this request and were told the same each time Yesterday, my fiance called to remind them about our request and NOT ONLY DID THEY SAY THAT THE UNIT WE REQUESTED WAS NOT the unit we are assigned, but also -- WE ARE BOOKED IN A UNIT ON THE BOTTOM FLOOR! I HATE staying on the first floor of any property and have not had to do so in many years. The noise above is ALWAYS a problem. . I have been on the telephone with the front desk staff for hours and NO ONE has attempted to solve this issue.Their attitude is "too bad, it's policy to put Intervalguests wherever...." I am hoping this experience is not indicative of the customer service at the resort. I don't think I am asking too much to want a room on the top floor but they are acting as if I am requesting a luxurious penthouse for the price of a standard room. They keep telling me that they can't change the room assignment and that the room was assigned when we booked through Interval -- that the unit number on the reservation is the one that we "purchased." BUT the most curious thing -- the units we are assigned do NOT coincide with what is on the reservation -- that tells me Hyatt DOES have the latitude to move people from one unit to another if there is a preference. Perhaps this IS a somewhat complicated process, but I always thought the business of hospitality was to have a guest leave feeling satisfied. I typically do not complain but this has me feeling so angry. I would think a Hyatt resort would want a Marriot owner to leave feeling that Hyatt is AT LEAST as interested in satisfying guest requests as is Marriot. On top of everything, they are making us move from one unit to another halfway through our stay. When I called Marriot/Interval Guest Services (at Hyatt's suggestion), they were quite surprised by the reaction of the people at the front desk and, of course, said that this would never happen at a Marriot -- they also said that if someone told us we could have a specific room -- even if it's not hotel policy -- the hotel should make EVERY attempt to honor our request. The clincher for the guest services representative was that they assigned us two separate rooms instead of leaving us in the same room for the duration of our stay. My last hope is that someone (who has the "power" to change our room location) at the Windward might see this posting and understand how important it is to honor a request that was granted by hotel staff, whether or not the staff member was qualified to make such an arrangement. As a business owner, I know that the customer should feel as though they are important and well cared for. This has not been the case so far. Mostly, I feel like a pain in the @@@ every time I call to let someone know about my dissatisfaction wi th the room assignment. At this point, it's the principle of the matter -- as a guest, I would like to be treated as though I matter. I will certainly follow up with a thorough review of the property. Let's hope the staff has the ability to provide the sort of service we are used to receiving at Marriot properties! I am having a difficult time believing the following -- which I found on Hyatt's website "Our goal is to deliver in every interaction an experience that builds positive, long-term relationships with you, our customer." So far, Hyatt rates WAY below Marriot in customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again..............”
Reviews.Author: TheWebSlayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. Really nice condo's - two bedroom, 2 bath, kitchen, balcony, washer/dryer. No noise from airport inside condo. Maid service came in every day which was nice. Beautifully decorated, spotless. They also provided dish and laundry detergent,paper towels. Telescope on balcony was nice touch although we didn't use it as the people in the condo across from us kept closing their drapes : ) Small but nice pool, table tennis, shuffleboard and pool table outside in pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, bit far from downtodn”
Reviews.Author: ChiliD9
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property. Great two bedroom suites, almost like a fully furnished condo. Pool very nice with views of ocean. Only drawback, opposite end of island to Mallory Square. No shuttle like most properties, therefore either need to pay for a cab if you plan to bar hop, or drive & pay to park.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place we have stayed on Key West”
Reviews.Author: scoothhi
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Key West for 5 years and stayed at several different properties. This one was our favorite so far. Check in was efficient and fast. They even got us in early. The staff was excellent from the front desk to the maintenance staff to the attendant at sandwich shop. The unit we stayed in had very nice decor and a great view of the ocean. Our family loved the pool which always had a nice breeze and lots of lounge chairs with a large surrounding deck. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT AND WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: VacaBound1111
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and spacious. Pool was large and surrounded by beautiful Palms. Abbys Snack shack very nice and great drinks. Grills on site are very nice . Grounds very well kept. Beds were very comfortable and so were pillows. Balconies are awesome and would be hard to beat. Lots of space. Staff was VERY friendly and had a perfect experience with them. I could go on and on but I have to say there is not anything I would do to change the place. Yes it is a short drive if you want to go anywhere but I did not have any trouble finding parking and driving around seeing the island is half the fun of it. Key West is only 2x4 miles so it is not far to get anywhere. Airport is not a big deal at all no matter what anyone says on this site. You hear a plane a couple times a day and when you do it is over and done within about 10 seconds.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: halterp11
Reviews.Content: We knew this resort was a couple miles from down town and preferred it that way. Sitting and relaxing while looking out over the Atlantic ocean was wonderful. This place is spotless and has everything you need to made a great vacation. Some people were complaining about airport noise here on TA- but honestly I did not have any negative experiences with that. I did see people walking to the airport as it is that close-but there are so few flights each day and they leave during the day...so unless you need to nap 24-7 it just was not an issue. We put our adult children and their kids next door at the Best Western and it was nice enough for the price too for a shorter stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: ManfromMass
Reviews.Content: This vacation resort is just that - a resort. It has a spa (which, I am sorry to say, I did not use). The pool is excellent, very clean and kept reasonably quiet, despite a few younger children there. Plenty of lounge chairs, and a snack bar close by for tropical drinks and light fare. The grounds are beautifully groomed with a large sand area for volleyball, and a quiet water cascading pond area for reflection. The rooms - where do I start. As near as I can tell, every room has a porch/deck with tables, chairs, rockers, and a telescope available. Our view of the pool and the ocean was fantastic. The huge king size bed in the master bedroom was tastefully decorated and the master bath was bigger than my dining room at home. It had a sauna tub as well as a spacious glass door shower, a separate room for the toilet, and double sinks. The guest bedroom had the second bath just across the hall. The open concept for the fully equipped kitchen, equisite dining room and comfortable living room was more than we expected. All with tiled flooring and plenty of ceiling fans (they only supplemented the A/C). The deck/porch is where I spent a lot of my time, especially in the quiet of the morning, watching the sun rise. One morning I was amazed at how calm the ocean was, it looked like a pond it was so smooth. Another morning I saw 4 military jets flying out over the ocean, manuvering in formation. During this week of relaxation, I managed to read three books. Total and complete escape from the real world. Like I said in the title, "Best Vacation Yet." This resort is near the Key West International Air Port, but the majority of planes are small jets or single engine ones. I found them more entertaining than intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “A true value!”
Reviews.Author: DonaldLavigne
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms were spotless and serviced everyday. The pool area is attended too on a daily basis. Very convenient to Key West airport without airport noise. At no time were we bothered by plains taking off or landing. Windward Pointe has a great location for beach goers, its one mile to smathers beach. The staff on the grounds always smile and say hi as you pass by. All rooms have a great view of the Atlantic ocean and the pool area. The two bedroom unit offered a full kitchen, living room, washer dryer, jacuzzi tub and telescope to check out all the boats going by. Plan a day by the pool, its so relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VAReviewer
Reviews.Content: I think the only reason this hotel isn't rated higher is because reviewers are comparing it to other Hyatt properties, not to other Key West hotels. I've stayed three other places in the Keys, and researched probably a hundred, and I think this property should be in the top 5, at least. While (a few) other Key West hotels boast of a "balcony" maybe big enough for a chair, or a location "near" the water, every unit at Hyatt Windward has a huge balcony with a view of the ocean. (And every balcony has a large table with 4 chairs, plus 2 rocking chairs.) From the balcony, the view of the ocean over the lush grounds, with the palm trees blowing in the breeze, was like a postcard of what a vacation should be. Notes: -- I was very familiar with the location, because on our last trip to Key West, we drove out there every night to walk along the ocean. From the Hyatt, we only had to cross the street for our daily ocean walk. (Note this is not a walk on the beach, that's not really something you can do anywhere in Key West for more than about half a block.) -- You could get by without a car, but that wouldn't be my preference. It's a long walk to anywhere (Old Town, grocery store, but a short drive. -- The kitchen comes with all dishes and utensils required to cook and eat, plus dish towels, dish soap, dishwasher soap, and coffee. Also they provide detergent for the clothes washer. -- Before going, I would have thought a room on the end (right by the ocean) would be best, and I'm sure they would be nice; but I think it might be better to have what we had, which was a room that looks over the grounds to the ocean. -- Very clean. Very responsive service (we need only one thing in 6 nights, but we got it right away). Good restaurant advice from concierge. Good wireless internet. Beautiful pool (a little more shade would have been nice); beautiful hot tub under the palm trees. What would we do differently next time? Cook in the room more . . . none of the restaurants thrilled us, frankly; but on our last day we found a great local fish market.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay at this Hyatt resort again”
Reviews.Author: stritzmom
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Windward Pointe resort was absolutely wonderful. The website pictures are exactly as the rooms appear. The room was clean and fresh when we arrived, the grounds were clean, the pool was great and the staff were great. It is a short distance from one of the public beaches. It was only a short distance to Duval Street. You are given a passport to use the facilities at the larger Hyatt Hotel in Downtown Key West, although the grounds at the Windward were much more spreadout and tropical. The pool was beautiful. We are already planning our trip next year with our children and their families.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: DIVERDICKFl_
Reviews.Content: Key west is always pricey.. We got a suite at the same price as a motel room at Best Western, next door. Beautiful property

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for friends getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cookiechiv
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this Hyatt vacation rental property and loved the whole experience. The "condo" was top quality and the view of the ocean and the grounds was spectacular from our unit (#5221) . We had a great time and enjoyed cooking fresh fish , etc in the fully equipped kitchen. I would stay there again and would encourage my friends to stay there too! Great value! Loved the pool. The planes at nearby airport were only slightly noticable. We slept like babies. You will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Our fabulous vacation in Kery West”
Reviews.Author: denisema
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Windward Point and were totally pleased with every aspect of the property and the personel. Our room was very clean upon arrival and of course stayed that way since we are neat people. The grounds were impecable, the pool was well maintained and the location for us was wonderful. Granted the airport is next door, but you do not hear flights through out the evening. This airport has limited flights in and out through out the day. We will defintely go back to this resort, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: NortheastTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Very nice townhouse with all the amenities of home. Far enough from downtown but an easy ride in. Very close to the beach and a great pool area at the hotel. Avoid the time share presentation and you will have a very nice time!!! The Airport is next door but I didn't hear any noise that woke me up but you can hear the planes all day over the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quieter location”
Reviews.Author: UpstateKiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights just out of spring break season. The hotel is a timeshare resort located at the top end of Key West by the airport. We had a fully equipped 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo with a great balcony. The location is great if you want to experience Key West lifestyle but not be right in the middle of everything downtown. Note that you will need transport to get around and get food/drinks etc. There is nothing at the Hyatt itself. You can get a bus into town from right outside the hotel and we rented bikes while there to fully explore the area. Note that they have an early check out time - we didn't catch this so were called while laying at the pool our last morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spread out”
Reviews.Author: djm2359
Reviews.Content: We all thoroughly enjoyed the 2 bedroom/2 bath suite after 3 nights in hotels with our 2 teenagers. The condo is beautiful, clean, and well maintained. The airport noise was not a bother - my husband works for a major airline and we have spent many nights in hotels that are at the end of a REAL runway! Most of the larger jets seemed to come in the afternoon when we were not at the hotel anyway. The earliest we heard a plane was 8:15. The only issue we had was at check-in. We arrived at 2:00,and were NOT made to feel like we were an inconvenience - in fact the man at the desk gave us a nice recommendation for lunch. When we came back at 4:00 (regular check-in time) we were told our room would not be ready for an hour and a half. (We finally got in at 5:45) So the manager offered us use of the pool and free drinks/food at the on site restaurant, and also let us use their refrigerator for perishable groceries that we had just bought. We were impressed with the honesty of the housekeeping staff. When we got to the airport in Miami, our 14 year old son realized he had left his watch and headphones in the nightstand in his room. When we called to check on them, we were informed that he had also left his camera and wallet, it was all in a bag in their safe, and they would send it to our home. Got the package from Fed-Ex 5 days later. Great service! One tip - be careful if you are booking this hotel on-line through the time-share owner. There were 2 parties while we were checking in that had done that, and were not able to check in until management had verified the owners were up to date on payments. We booked our condo through the Hyatt website and had no problems. We were also asked to sign a "contract" stating that we would not party/drink/be loud, etc. since it was spring break, which was great for us as a family. There were no distubances while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at a nice two bedroom and two bath apartment.”
Reviews.Author: owlhours
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Windward Pointe is exactly what we needed. For those of us that always have to work while in vacation, the two bedrooms and the living room provided the necessary space and comfort so that I could work while the rest of my family was sleeping. I did not care for the gardener trimming the grass on a Saturday morning, but other than that we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMF62
Reviews.Content: "This is not a Hotel" as it was very clearly pointed out to me when I checked in this year. I had asked for early check in but this was not available and as I am not an "owner" I was made to feel a second class citizen. This was our third time at this resort and there are still a lot of good things about the resort i.e the pool and grounds, but unfortunately the Airport noise is starting to become a real issue and the house keeping was at best poor, additionally the old CRT based TV's in the rooms this year looked seriously out of place in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Outside of town, spacious and private”
Reviews.Author: JPhoebus
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is not a Duvall St. property, so you should bring a car or expect a $10 cab ride into town. But not being in town, this is also an incredibly quiet resort. And it has a fantastic view of the ocean across the highway - which is also lined with a broad sidewalk that's great for walking, jogging or biking. Moreover, these are spacious and well-appointed apartments, with features on a par with those you'd expect in a 4-star hotel. Of course since this is not a hotel, the staff is small, but exceptionally attentive and responsive - from Amber at the front desk to Linda the concierge to Reinaldo in engineering. From sitting on the balcony to relaxing by the pool to napping in the hammock, there wasn't an unpleasant moment to be found here.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: frozensky
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite was impeccable and well appointed. The grounds were well kept and very beautiful. Our room had great view of the ocean and the grounds. They even provided telescope on our balcony. The balcony area had a big table for seating 6. We had nice breakfast looking over the ocean from our balcony. The pool area had ping pong, pool table, hammock, BBQ grill, etc. Even though it's not walking distance to Duval Sreet, the drive was very easy and short. We highly recommend this place. The masterbath was huge with jet tube.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: GailSK
Reviews.Content: We loved this vacation. This Hyatt is close to the Key West airpot so flight noise is heard. Our room was closest to the Hwy so that is also heard. That said.. we didn't feel that was a problem. The room was great, the view, the iguanas that sit in the top of the palms next to the room, the grounds were beautiful. The Abbie Road was run by a very nice man and the food was fresh and tasty. The pool was clean and situated in a wonderful spot on the grounds. When you check in you are given a sheet to mark off items in the kitchen etc. We went through it and found a couple of problems. I called the front desk and they came right up and fixed the items. It is not a cheap place to stay that is for sure, Key West is not cheap. I loved this hotel and I would love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELER06877
Reviews.Content: An exceptional, elongated stay (due to NE snow storm) Staff was cordial and accommodating to requests (extra towels, battery for TV remote control The property is beautiful and very well maintained. FREE PARKING included, which is an important perk for KW. Try Abondonza (spelling?), the best Italian food in the Keys! Abbey Road on property makes great Mango Margaritas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a safe place-hide and lock up valuables!!"”
Reviews.Author: mommd88
Reviews.Content: My entire immediate family stayed for 6 nights (11 people-3 rooms). Although overall I would rate the hotel as okay, on the next to last day I had a very nice piece of jewelry stolen out of my room. I knew the exact time and place and it was during the time i left the room for the house keepers to clean. I didn't accuse anyone specifically but felt very sure it had be stolen either by them or someone who sneaked in when they were cleaning. The house keeping assured me that they take these matters seriously with a police investigation and that she would keep in touch with me. It has been two weeks since then and I still have no resolution to this problem. I have had to call each time to get any information and there has been no mention of an investigation. This type of security is not at all what i would expect from a Hyatt, but the hotel is right on the main road in town. In addition the lack of followup is very poor. thank goodness we used the safe for our computers and ipods. I was just going to the pool while they cleaned and took of my ring without thinking. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BURGERS AT ABBEY ROAD!!”
Reviews.Author: pantherPtPleasant
Reviews.Content: Sitting at the pool relaxing, I couldn't help but notice the scent of what I thought was a cookout going on somewhere. Later I went to the Abbey Road pool bar for a beverage and lo and behold, the cookout was right there. Behind the counter was Randy (the owner) cooking on a flat top grill andthere was absolutely no room for another burger. Seems to be his big seller. I later took him up on his challenge of telling me they are the best burgers on the island Glad I did. It was awesome. Didn't fool with any crazy toppings etc-Just the burger on a roll. Later in the week had other things off of the menu like a blackened grouper sandwich, yellowtail, wraps, salads among others and they were just as good. So if you just want to relax and hang by the pool and leave the Duval Crawl for later, there is no better place to relax than at Abbey Road

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to do but sit around... No food or drink”
Reviews.Author: Pete7919
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with one major problem right now. There is no food or drink available at all. The on site snack bar called Abbey Rd is closed. When we were there it had no roof and there was no explanation from anyone about what was going on. We were not told when we booked and the staff was not surprised. Bottom line is if you want a quiet hotel with nothing going on this is the place for you. Very quiet and peaceful... Oh, wait, no it's not. It's right at the end of the airport runway. Anyone who says that doesn't bother them probably made the mistake of buying a timeshare here and is kidding themselves. The first flight takes off at 8:11am every morning and it feels like the airplane is about to crash into the hotel every time. Every 15 minutes or so another plane takes off and the sound is deafening. The rooms are very large and were clean. The full kitchen is a great amenity if travelling on a budget. Keep in mind that you do not get full housekeeping here, either. No fitness center. This is a timeshare resort so I knew it wouldn't have the same amenities as the full service resort, but until the food reopens stay away! Also, you need a car to stay here in order to get anywhere. Alternatively, there is a scooter rental that was recommended to us that can drop a scooter off at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort away from Duval”
Reviews.Author: tomandnikki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travaled to Key West with another couple and stayed at the Hyatt Windward for a week in September. The resort is very well kept and the grounds are beautiful. Our large 2 bedroom/2 bath suite had a huge balcony and beautiful views of the pool and Atlantic. The beach is about 1/2 mile down the road but you still have great views. It is right next to the airport, but there are only a few flights in and out a day so it wasn't a big deal. I have been to Key West before and stayed closer to Duval. If you are going away for a quick weekend trip, you might want to stay closer to town (Ocean Key or Hyatt on Front St are nice or Simonton Court if don't like chains) so you can walk to all the bars and restaurants on Duval. If you are going for a little longer and want someplace away from the craziness to relax - this place is perfect. I would definately recommend having a car for the week or you will be spending a lot of money on cabs. We drove from Sarasota so we had a car and it only took about 10 mins to get from the resort to all the action and there is a Publix right down the road too so you can stock the kitchen. We spent a lot of time having coffee and mimosas in the morning on the balcony, sitting around the pool and chillin in the room. The resort was pretty empty which was nice but the on site bar/restaurant was closed the entire week which was kind of a bummer. There were quite a few restaurants closed downtown too so it must be because it's so quiet this time of year. Overall - great place. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: simimports
Reviews.Content: This is a great family location..Lovely pool and snack bar..Very clean grounds..Ocean across the street and beach very close.I thought the airport might be a noise problem but it wasn't at all..Slept great..The condos are very roomy and well equipped..have paid more for much less.We had a great time here and absolutely no problems..

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: bsqd50
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the good stuff. The grounds were very nice, and the pool bar/snack shack, Abbey Road, was great. The menu was limited but very good and there was a 2 for 1 happy hour everyday. The pool was very nice and also clean. Unfortunately, there are some minuses...Just recently jets are now allowed to land and take off from the Key West International Airport. Well, this facility literally backs up to the runway! The jets started taking off at 6:30 a.m. and landed through the evening. This is beyond the control of the facility, since there were no jets at the time the facility opened. You still need to be aware this is not a QUIET resort by any means. When we arrived, we couldn't find a rolling luggage rack anywhere to carry all our stuff up the to the third floor. NONE of the staff we encountered could understand or speak English. This was really frustrating. My husband called housekeeping, but we never did get a rack and made many trips to get moved in. We did encounter some problems with the unit: bugs in the kitchen; and, sorry water pressure such that it took 5 minutes to get hot water in the kitchen sink and another 5 or more to get enough water to wash the dishes and pans. We were to dry our own pool towels for the week and they were reluctant to give us fresh pool towels. Most resorts have a towel hut for easy exchanges daily. There was quite a bit of noise and smell from the landscaping maintenance during times when people would be out at the pool and wanting a more quiet and peaceful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGangAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in April and would rate this hotel as by far the best on this trip. As noted in many reviews this hotel is across the street from the ocean with no beach and adjacent to the airport which is getting busier. These are the things that make it affordable. We paid $225/ night for our four night stay in a two bedroom, two bath condo with an in-suite washer and dryer, beautiful grounds and an amazing pool this is on par or less that most hotel rooms in Key West. There was daytime noise from the airport but the road is not very busy. There was also a lot of air traffic from the Naval Air Station, however we were there on the air show weekend (the airshow itself was spectacular) and didn't find seeing the Blue Angels flying at low altitude past our balcony bothersome. The room was exceptionaly clean with daily maid service. The front desk and cleaning staff were friendly and the beds were very comfortable. The balcony was huge and well equipped. The hotel had easy acess in and out and was a short drive to shopping (the Publix was great and had a good wine selection) and downtown. Snuba of Key West took us on an amazing trip and our favorite place for food was Fishbusterz Shrimp Shack who have andoutside dining area and a great selection of really fresh seafood to take home (a note to all us northerners, the shrimp here are Florida pinks which are pink when there raw and after they are cooked, unlike the ones we buy which become pink when you cook them). Also we were facinated by the local racoons which are very pale in color. We only found two negative things: 1) checkout is at 10 am which was a bit of a hurry but got us on the road at a decent time (the trip to and from Key West is very interesting but slow). 2) The Abby Road Snack Shack (I believe it is run by an independent operator) has OK burgers and so-so drinks and charges an automatic %20 gratuity if you charge to your room (there is counter service only) which they don't mention. Also they put our charge through twice which didn't seem to surprise the girls at check out time and they corrected the charge immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: maedea72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe for 3 nights in April . We were so impressed with the standard of our room and location. The airport is very close to this complex but wasnt too intrusive. Travelling with young children it was good to get away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street which without transport is quite a walk. We had hired a convertible Mustang so we didnt need to depend on taxis etc. The gardens are magnificent and our boys thoroughly enjoyed the the swimming pool and the spa. The rooms exceeded our expectation. If these condos were situated anywhere in Europe they would be rated as 5* without a doubt and not the 3.5* rating it has been awarded. We will be booking the Hyatt Windward Pointe on our next trip to Key West!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views & Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Sbabs01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key west for the first time with children in april and were more than pleased with the hyatt. Beautiful rooms with large kitchens, publix & winn dixie grocery stores nearby so you can stock it. A great poolside grill with good food where owner Randy can give you directions to the best seafood only known to locals. Poolside grills will be prepared and lit for you. Beautiful views from the pool and beaches within walking distance. Duval street is a quick cab ride or drive away. Great maid service daily! Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accommodation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: DianeAndy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 7 nights in early March & found the complex exceeded our expectations. The apartment was spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a well equipped kitchen, lounge & large balcony. The public areas were well maintained & the staff were friendly & helpful. The gardens were well kept & the pool area was lovely with comfortable sunbeds. A car is essential as the complex is a few miles from Key West town centre & taxis are expensive. Parking in the centre of Key West is very expensive but we did find a multi-storey car park which was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: ck1sunrise
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week's stay at the Hyatt Windward Point. We are Hyatt Timeshare owners. We own in Bonita Springs and decided to swap for this trip. I must say I love the location. It's only a short 7 minute drive into downtown Key West. We never had any trouble finding parking and it was great to get away from the "craziness" of old town to the peace and quite the Hyatt Windward Point has to offer. My husband still says he would prefer to stay at the Hyatt Sunset Harbor since you can walk everywhere from that location. I however disagree. It's very busy in old town and I loved the fact that in a few minutes you could be away from it all and enjoy the gorgeous water views from our huge balcony! Plus there was a volleyball court, shuffle board, ping pong etc. for my teenage son. The timeshare rooms were beautiful and met all of our expectations. The only drawback was the road that separated the hotel from the ocean. It would have been picture perfect if there wasn't a road. However I enjoyed taking long walks along the sea wall across the street. Some reviews complain about the airport noise. It wasn't a big deal at all. Quite frankly most of the airline noise wasn't from the airport next door but was from the fighter pilot's doing their training. Many fighter jets thru out the day. Again no big deal kind of cool to watch them literally ZIP on by. We would stay here again without question. Some fun things to do was the Fury "commotion on the ocean" sunset cruise. They had live band on catamaran and we had a blast. Also recommend the Danger Cruise full day backcountry excursion. We went sailing, snorkeling and kayaking around the mangrove islands. A fabulous trip. The boys also did the 27 mile jet-ski trip around key west and had a ball. The butterfly conservatory on Duvall Street was beautiful and I would say it's a fun thing to do too!! The Yankee Freedom trip to the Dry Tortuga Islands was not worth the $150.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at this resort”
Reviews.Author: figmentsas
Reviews.Content: Wife and I and our 2 kids (ages 12 and 6) just returned from Key West from 3/27-4/2 and stayed at Hyatt Windward Point. We paid $225/night for a large 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo and were fortunate enough to get an ocean view with a large rotunda lanai. The condo was fantastic. The furnishings were nice (not cheesy) and the kitchen was modern. The bathrooms were large and the beds were a king and a queen and not at all lumpy. There were no ants or tiny critters (we were on the 2nd floor). The condo was clean, and the daily maid service tidied up everything. The grounds were beautiful and the service desk was competent. The airport noise runs from 9am thru 9pm, but it isn't like being at JFK, there are very few flights, and after the first day, you barely noticed them. Shoot, I think I heard more airplane noise from the jets at the nearby Naval Air Station than from the airport. I guess my only con is that I heard floor noise from my upstairs neighbor or the water pipe noise from a toilet flushing or water draining from the jacuzzi tub in the master bath. The resort is on the eastern side of Key West, far from all the restaurants/bars on Duval Street, you will need a car or public transportation to do anything. But that is okay, the place is quiet (the windows are double insulated), there is free parking, I found it to be a safe place for a family, and the price can't be beat. We enjoyed our stay at this resort and would highly recommend it for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaKimberly
Reviews.Content: They Hyatt was a great hotel with great service. My husband and I along with another couple stayed in a two bedroom/two bath suite (room 5132) which had plenty of space and a direct ocean view. We booked a three night special for $225 per night which was a great deal for Key West. Unfortunately Key West itself left a lot to be desired. Duval street was very busy, especially at night due to Spring Break. Our one attempt at Smather's beach was ruined when someone was arrested for stealing from people while they were in the water. We also cancelled our snorkeling trip due to winds/low visibility. I would highly recommend the Hyatt Windward pointe for a relaxing vacation in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: tikilounge
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be right downtown in the mix of Key West, this is not the hotel for you. If you are travelling with family or a group and want a great value this is the place for you. This property is located a few miles from the downtown area. The units have two bedroom, two full bath, full kitchen and living room, laundry and a huge lanai. The pool area is beautiful and clean and pretty much every room has a view of the pool and the beach and water across the street. I paid $50 less per night for all of this than I would have for a standard two bed hotel room at a nearby hotel. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and the units are very nicely appointed. The airport was nearby, but flight noise was not an issue. We really loved the privacy abd versatility this property afforded. The only negatives we encountered were some noise at night (but it was Spring Break) and horrible water pressure and temperature in the second bathroom. Otherwise the stay was terrific. This is my second visit to this property and I will look to stay here any time I am in KW.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit Was Good!”
Reviews.Author: BigTex23
Reviews.Content: We are Hyatt Vacation Club owners and made our first visit to Key West during Spring Break. Some of the reviews from January and February made us nervous, but we agree with the most recent reviews. Saw no bugs in our unit, grounds are meticulously maintained, pool is great. We prefer the location away from Duval Street...it was nice coming home to something quiet. Unit is well appointed and clean. Patio is good sized and one of the highlites overlooking the grounds and ocean. The only negatives we found were marginal water pressure in shower, and the shower floor needed regrouting, plus the master bedroom bed was a bit soft. It's not one of the Hyatt Grand beds. Found most of the restaurants in town to be pricey...so search for lunches off the beaten path. Everything on Duval is tourist driven and often overpriced.
