Yes, the resort is next door to the airport, and yes, there are some night flights. The last one is about 930 and the first one about 8 am...half of them turbo props and half regional jets. Make no mistake, you hear them taking off or landing, but usually just for a minute or so, so not a big deal. Did notice during spring break some college aged kids confessed to us they sneaked onto the property to use the pool and hot tub, but they were well-behaved. Plenty of parking at resort, we often had to search for parking downtown...but always found some. usually about 1.50 per hour with meters. This resort is nice, but not quite as good as the Highlands Inn at Carmel, or the Park Hyatt Residences at Beaver Creek. It's well kept, and one of the best properties in Key West. We visited halof a dozen of the other nice ones to compare...almost everyone sold out during spring break week. At many other hotels/condos, you're right on top of the next door neighbor. Not so at Windword Pointe.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LetsgoPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in January and found it great. Yes, you really need a car to stay here and see all of Key West, but that also allows you to retreat to the peace and quiet here when you want it. The grounds are immaculately maintained and the pool is one of the largest we saw at any hotel in Key West. The units are well-furnished and well-maintained, they didn't cut corners on quality here. The management is friendly and responsive. The resort is adjacent to the airport, but we didn't find that a problem because there are no night flights there. Best beach in Key West by far is the state park at Fort Jackson. There is a modest entrance fee and plenty of free parking right at the beach. They have beach chair rentals and a nice snack bar, but be advised all concessions are cash only - no credit cards. Best high-end restaurant is Louie's Backyard - ocean front dining and the food and service are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been more pleased with the Hyatt Windward Pointe”
Reviews.Author: Joy53MI
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Key West and really didn't have any high end expectations. It all changed when we drove into the Hyatt Windward Pointe! The front desk was extremely accommodating, the grounds were immaculate, and the pool and view from the pool were post card perfect, and the bartender was so helpful in pointing out areas of interest. We stayed on the 3rd floor turret condo, with 180 degrees of ocean. The condo was in excellent condition, CLEAN and the housekeeping was great. We can't wait to return. When we did go to Duval Street, we were so happy to be coming back to this serene place. Make sure you take in A & B Lobster House for dinner - unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Us”
Reviews.Author: whinta
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner here for several years and just returned last week. I'd read several recent reviews and was worried that my investment was not being properly maintained. I'd also seen some other properties being highly praised and wondered whether Windward Pointe was keeping pace, so I checked out some of these other places. I can now firmly report that I need not consider selling my unit for an "upgrade." There is no place I'd rather stay in KW for what I want. Contrary to what some people may want, the location suits me for several reasons. First, it is on South Roosevelt overlooking the Atlantic. To me, this is far superior to the places on North Roosevelt, which is a busy commercial thoroughfare. South Roosevelt does not get the same kind of traffic, and even though the road is between the property and the ocean, I am not bothered by that at all. In fact, one of the things I like to do is walk or bike at sunrise on the seawall, so the location of the property is perfect for that. Second, I like that the property is away from Old Town. It's quiet at night and it's quiet during the day. If I want to enjoy the activities in town, it's a short drive away. In my mind, the reason a circus is only 2 hours long is because that is all the time most people want to spend viewing it. For KW this may be a minority view, but it's mine. Finally, it is true that the property abuts the airport, but I've never really been disturbed by the noise. Every once in a while a decent-sized craft takes off, but in a few seconds it's over. You can always complain about something, but to me it is no more than a quibble. Actually, I was more disturbed when the grass was being cut at 8AM one day. There is one further advantage to the somewhat remote location. As land is very precious in KW, some properties have units that are cheek-by-jowl and look a bit cramped. At Windward Pointe there is ample room, big balconies a lawn area, parking, and wide sidewalks. As for the living quarters, we are talking about a time-share condominium property. You get towel and garbage service every day (and more often if needed and requested), but a full service only once at mid-week. If you need an additional room service, you can pay for it. The kitchen is beautiful. You have everything you need, and you can save a lot if you are willing to eat in once in a while. The bedrooms and baths are also beautiful. For someone traveling with children, it would be nice if the second bedroom had twin beds instead of a queen, but I knew the arrangement when I purchased the unit (I was told there was a fire code issue, which I frankly find hard to believe -- but that's just how it is). Also, the balconies are really nice with really nice furniture. I've read, I've eaten, I've had card games (day and night), I've played with my laptop out there. You can't beat it. I've never had an issue with any of the TVs, DVD player or other appliances. In fact, l think having the washer/dryer is really nice because you can pack light and go home with clean clothes. Finally, the place has always been spotless -- it isn't like, as with some places, you walk around in white socks and they are dirty or you see cigar ashes. A couple of reviews talked about bugs. I certainly haven't been bugged. To comment on the common facilities: (1) There is plenty of parking; (2) The heated pool and hot tub areas are well-maintained -- and are even bigger than some larger quarters on the island (plenty for a place with only about 90 units); (3) The snack facility seems to be widely enjoyed (we make our own sandwiches); (4) There is a place for shuffleboard, pool, table tennis, and volleyball as well as some other games that you can check out from the front desk; (5) The management will set you up if you want to cook out -- it was kind of nice doing that one night as we looked out over the water; (6) if you want a fitness center, I'm told the one in the Hyatt hotel is available; and (7) The overall grounds (flowers/trees/lighting/lobby/pool furniture) are well-maintained. There is coffee in the lobby every morning. As a final note, I've never had an issue with any of the staff. The concierge service is adequate. I once had to call about a broken screen and it was fixed within an hour. I suppose anyone can have an experience that is a clunker, and I will not be critical of anyone to whom it has happened. I think that can happen anywhere, however, and I've seen no evidence that it happens too frequently at Windward Pointe. As you might expect, the property is geared for families, and you do need a car. If you want to be part of a party place, this is not it. If you want the full service of a hotel, this is not it. If you want Old Town or a place to stay where you can walk everywhere, this is not it. If you want a quaint bed and breakfast, this is not it. If, however, you want a quiet family-oriented luxury condominium overlooking the ocean with beautiful units and facilities, I've yet to see any better in KW.

Reviews.Title: “We expected less...”
Reviews.Author: bob2010California
Reviews.Content: we had some concern based on other reviews but found this property to be just fine. Yes, there was some airport noise, but nothing that had any impact on our stay. We enjoyed being away from the action and found it very easy to drive to where we wanted to be. Parking in Key West was also much less of a hassle than we were led to believe (the Mallory Square lot worked every time and is not expensive). The housekeeping services were hit or miss, but it wasn't a big deal, we at least always had plenty of clean towels. The suite seemed clean and the amenities were adequate. Pool area was fine (and yes, it does fill up quickly when the weather is nice). The drinks in the pool restaurant are a little watered down, but not awful. The 10 am check out time was startling and we felt rushed, but otherwise, nothing was outstanding, but nothing was really awful either.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DarleneMAM
Reviews.Content: When Ginger and I left Hyatt Windward Point on Sunday morning we closed the condo door for the last time on the lukewarm water, dim lighting, slow drain in guest bathroom, tiny, almost invisible spiders running around on the kitchen countertops and funky WiFi. We also left behind the uncomfortable queen-size mattress in the 2nd bedroom, the rooster who crowed daily at dawn, the neighboring balcony that is so close to the master bedroom window you can take part in conversations that arenâ€™t any of your business and tough-to-work main television clicker. The morning was cold and we wheeled our suitcases and detritus down the long side of building 8 across the back side of building 8, along the zig zag sidewalk toward the next building and on toward the elevator, the nearest (get it?) elevator to our condo unit (yes, that elevator; see my January 8th blog post "Trapped in Paradise" at www.adventuresofamiddleagemom.wordpress.com for details). We dodged the rainy puddles left from the previous dayâ€™s torrential rains as we wheeled along, talking about our upcoming breakfast at Camilleâ€™s. We wheeled up in front of the elevator, pushed the â€œdownâ€� button and waited. The wind blew and the puddles at our feet rippled. Huddled into my jacket, I pressed the button again, but no elevator came. We waited some more, then finally gave up. The elevator was out of order, but without a sign to let us know. We bounced our wheelies and detritus down the three long flights of steps and wheeled, kinda breathless, into the lobby to check out. At the front desk I handed in our two keys. The young woman working the desk printed out my receipt and asked how everything was. I replied, â€œWell, the clicker for the main television in our unit isnâ€™t working at all well. Someone must have lost the back to the clicker and then taped the batteries in with black electrical tape. It will need repaired before someone else checks in.â€� The young woman lost her smile and replied, â€œOk. Thank you for telling me.â€� â€œAlso,â€� I continued, â€œI was the one trapped in the elevator two days ago and I want to let you know that it isnâ€™t working this morning either. My friend and I waited and waited, but it didnâ€™t arrive on the third floor so we had to bounce our suitcases down the three flights.â€� The young woman gave me a brief look and replied, â€œWe already know the elevator isnâ€™t working,â€� as she turned and walked away. I have loved every Hyatt property I have ever stayed at. . .until now. This one made me grouchy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Images_7
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for New Years and stayed at Windward Point. It is far away from the nightlife, so we took a taxi. It would be nice if they had a shuttle!. Our room and view were great. The pool and small bar/restaurant were nice. The front desk personnel could be a bit more pleasant/accommodating. We overheard problems with other people's units and bills, which were not met with as they should be in a Hyatt property. We, however, had no problems, and a nice time in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Has something changed?”
Reviews.Author: snwbrdwndsrf
Reviews.Content: The reviews for the Hyatt Windward Pointe Resort hare are phenomenal, and we were *really* looking forward to our stay here, but at the halfway point we are incredibly disappointed. There are a number of reasons for this: 1. The literature indicated that our one-bedroom suite included a full kitchen, but they gave us the handicapped room which does not include an oven. I understand and appreciate that the hotel includes handicap-accessible rooms, but we had planned to cook most of our meals and the lack of oven was going to derail most of our cooking plans. When we talked with the front desk about changing rooms, we were informed that there were no rooms available and (exact quote) "What do you want me to do, go out and build you another building? This conversation is over." Ok, it was new years week and they may very well have been full, but that kind of response is rude and unacceptable, and the literature was disingenuous. The man we spoke with is Peter, who is the Acting Property Manager. 2. They won't clean our room (they just make the beds and drop fresh towels on the floor). Two days in, after we'd complained about the poor room service, we were informed that the 8 day package that we purchased includes full room service only once, and that that day was Tuesday. Not only were we not informed of this reduced service when we booked our room, but they didn't even schedule the full service for the mid-point of our stay! (Tuesday is the day before we leave.) We did not get this room last minute or at a significant discount -- this is prime vacation time, and we paid full price! 3. The walls transmit every sound. This hotel is built next to the airport, and it is fairly new, so there were codes requiring adequate noise insulation during construction. These codes were obviously not met: we can hear every plane, all of our neighbors (next to us and above us), and everybody who walks by (especially when they're dragging a suitcase across the tiles) -- and with crystal clarity. There are some positives: the grounds are nice (but don't lay on the grass: you'll get bug bites galore), the pools are great, and the location is wonderful (walk out to the water and enjoy the sunset)! However, terrible service and having to wear ear plugs to get a good night's sleep really ruins the experience. They can improve the service (and I hope they do!), but there's little they can do to address the noise issue. Perhaps our experience is unique (given the reviews that have been posted so far), but I'm offering this as fair warning that things may have changed recently. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: desmo
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the hotel and my two daughter were also. The problems we had were small, but for the money one pays for this hotel, this should not be the case. We called down for ice one night, which we were told we could, and we were told to get the bucket out of freezer and bring it down (for $400 + a nite we thought that was a little much), The ice maker was not working. Housekeeping only can 2 times in the 6 days we were there. On one day they took all the beach towels and never returned them so we hunted them down. We had to call another nite because the ceiling fan in the guest bedroom wa falling off the ceiling. No one ever came. The ATM never worked when we stayed there. On the up side the place is beautiful. The snack shack was the best with the best bartenders, too bad they do not have a bar/dining area for the nite hours. People were very friendly and staff was at times helpful. It is too far from downtown, I wish they had FREE shuttle service like alot of other hotels/condo do. Even a free shuttle to the airport would be a plus. When one is traveling with 4 or more that is a lot of luggage, so I think free service for the 2 minutes ride would be a selling point. I also think they should update their website. They make the rooms looks alot bigger (which you don't need) then the are, and pool shot looks like an infinity pool, which it is not, and they should also mention that the airplanes will wake you up early in the am.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Riley0221
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 2 of our friends stayed at this hotel for 5 days and we absolutely loved it!! When we got there we were blown away by how spacious the rooms were and the incredible view! This hotel is not downtown in the heart of things, but it was great because we could actually get some sleep and then enjoy a relaxing time at the pool without a whole lot of commotion, etc. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay there again should I return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Caezette
Reviews.Content: We were married during our stay at the Hyatt. We so impressed with the hotel and the staff. Yes a bit out of the way be we rented scooters. Loved the property and the spacious room. We didnt want to leave. Randy at Abbey Road was awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “noisy planes”
Reviews.Author: Lori W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, great helpful staff. Noisy planes next door that woke us up everyday at 6:30 AM. Couldn't figure out the public bus system and was stranded a couple times so, rented a scooter. Resort is on the oppiset side of the island from all the activities and nightlife. Didn't care for the location. If you want the bar nightlife scene this isn't the resort for you, it's to far when your drunk. If you want a quiet, peaceful relaxing vacation on beautiful prisine grounds than this is the place for you. I would recommend a room in the front away from the noisy airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hooptymoo
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place. The unit was absolutely beautiful -- very roomy, spotless and well appointed. This is the first timeshare I've ever stayed at where the room was serviced every day. There were plenty of lawn chairs around the pool and the grounds were well appointed. Although others have complained of noise from the airport (next door), we didn't find any problem with the flights taking off or landing. The only plane noise came from military planes in the area. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone. Even though it's a couple of miles from Duval Street, it's only a short drive.

Reviews.Title: “If I could dream up the perfect honeymoon suite, this would be it!”
Reviews.Author: intheair2night
Reviews.Content: View overlooking the Atlantic. Negative-edge pool. Gigantic tub. Comfy beds. Cozy kitchen, dining and living rooms. Intimate balcony (with telescope for star-gazing). This is the place to stay if you are looking for class and comfort. I was incredibly happy with our stay at Hyatt Windward Pointe. Staff was friendly ... even saw a baby raccoon! It was like a home away from home (complete with washer and dryer! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Timeshare Oriented”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelingalot
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a weekend at this Hyatt on a recent trip to Keywest. The hotel is beautiful and a short drive from most attractions on the island of Keywest. We were annoyed with the very aggresive timeshare sales people in the lobby. We stayed at the property on a AAA rate, but for some reason we were bothered by call, in person and in writing about there timeshares as if we were there on some free weekend package. Otherwise this is a very clean and nice Hyatt and although I think I will consider a different hotel next time, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: jemgk
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation here. The units were very nicely laid out and had everything we needed. We did have several small repairs that needed to be made, but they were tended to right away and we were very pleased. All the staff we had contact with were pleasant and professional. The grounds were well manicured and the location away from the hustle and bustle of Old Town was excellent. We were on a time share exchange and it was one of the best we have ever done!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jclc1213
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is a beautiful resort with 2 bedroom condos, updated furnishings and beautiful amenities. It has a saltwater pool that overlooks the ocean. It is right near a bus stop and the walkway where every one runs and walks runs along roosevelt right in front of the resort. We stayed here a week 8/30 - 9/6/09 (yes, still here!) The downside: There are no restaurants within 2 miles and you have to drive everywhere (benihana is next door but is always dead). It is approx. 2.5 miles to duval street or anything good in key west or stock island. Publix is about 2 miles as well. So, if you like quiet and away from the scene, this the place for you. The sales staff was surprised I was able to exchange through Interval Intl and apparently its hard to get in here. If I had a choice, I'd prefer Sunset Harbor in Old Town so I could walk everywhere, all things considered. Another downside is the noise - we are in building 5 - the airport is very loud. You can hear every plane that lands and takeoff and the noise in the condo above us (we are on floor 2) wakes us up every time they slide a door or drag a chair. Our neighbors are up all hours of the night, so sleep is an issue but . . . some people are just rude and inconsiderate. There is a beeping noise in the electrical room, after 4 days here, we have finally figured out how to reset the fire alarm b/c it is so annoying, you cannot sit outside without getting a headache. There are beautiful balconies that overlook the pool and ocean, so serene and relaxing. The kitchen is fully furnished and you can cook anything. Coffee makers, free wireless, etc. There are some grills, but you have to use charcoal. We have found all of the fresh fish markets and may take them up on it, but not really sure why there aren't gas grills. Other than the noise problems, every one is very friendly and this is a beautiful place. The Poolside Shack is good and they have happy hour every day with 2 for 1, great frozen drinks and food. This place is a gem if you don't want to be in the action and have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....until they refused to honor Hyatt's rate”
Reviews.Author: bleumastiff
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the accommodations when we arrived. The condo has 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms which were awesome with 2 teenage girls. The balcony was large with a nice table and chairs. We were in building #2 on the second floor. Our room faced the sand volleyball court and pool. Our ocean view was nice (and we were close) but the buildings (near the road) facing the ocean would have the better unobstructed views. The grounds were well maintained. This facility is near the airport but I only heard a few planes when I was outside. The room has a washer and dryer which were great. Housekeeping checked in every day to see if we needed anything. The kitchen is well stocked but I would suggest not leaving any food out. We had some pastries in a plastic container which we had to throw away due to finding them covered with ants after only being on the counter overnight. The problem started at checkout. I made our reservations through Hyatt.com on May 7. On July 15, I noticed that our room rate had decreased. Hyatt advertises a best rate guarantee so I contacted Hyatt reservations by phone for an adjustment and received a confirmation email. When I went to checkout, the front desk receptionist Daniel Parker handed me my receipt showing my balance owed. It did not include my rate adjustment and was more than my original reservation rate. I showed him my email confirmation from Hyatt reservations with my new rate. He explained there was nothing he could do because he could not adjust my rate. I asked to speak to the manager. The manager Peter Tsidenkov also reviewed my confirmation email. He also explained that they could not adjust my rate and told me I would have to call reservations since I made my reservations online. When I was questioning how they could not honor a reservation made with Hyatt, Daniel became condescending and rude. The same 2 men were telling a lady in front of me the same thing when she was complaining about her bill. I told them both that this must be a pattern. I then contacted Chris from Hyatt reservations. He placed me on hold for quite some time and came back to explain that the Windward Pointe staff were reporting I made my reservations online through a third party (i.e. Expedia) so I needed to contact the third party. Chris explained that he told them my reservations were through Hyatt. I explained to Chris that I also showed Daniel and Peter my confirmation email from Hyatt. After being on the phone for an hour, Chris told me that they were going to honor my rate adjustment. I returned to the desk to get a new receipt so I would have written proof. We will definitely return to Key West but will not stay with Hyatt Windward Pointe again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the trip, hated to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: ach72
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our 1st Key West vacation. The hyatt windward was a great place to stay. We got this place through our timeshare exchange program, Interval International. The condo was very comfortable for our family of 4. It was very clean, neat & well maintained. Our "must-haves" for vacation (w/d, full kitchen, ocean view, 2 bed/2 bath, etc) were all there! Yes, it's close to the airport but we hardly ever heard a plane while we were inside. A few times we played games or had a meal on the balcony & enjoyed watching the few planes that would fly by. The staff were very helpful & answered any questions about the area. We saw an iguana in the parking lot one day & then another one by the pool on a different day. We highly suggest going to Ft. Zachery beach if you want to play in the water or snorkle. In our opinion it's the best beach. We would for sure stay at this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “A few miles from Duval but a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kam9s
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time and loved our stay at the Hyatt Windward Point. Having been to Key West before, we knew our way around and decided to bike everywhere! We didn't get a rental car- the hotel is less than .25 miles from the airport so it's an easy walk. We ordered bikes from Conch rentals ahead of time and had them delivered to the hotel the same day we arrived- then we just biked everywhere! The timeshare is about 2.5 miles from town (Duval Street) so if you're not athletic a car may be needed. Many of the cabs have bike racks or will just put bikes in their trunk so it's easy enough to get a taxi home from dinner/drinks if you don't want to make the bike back in the dark (cab ride should be no more than $15-16+tip from duval to hotel). The timeshare itself is gorgeous and clean with fabulous views of the ocean. Everything is new and it's very spacious and conducive to 2 couples. I recommend Fort Zachery beach (where we went every day) which is closer to Duval Street and it's the best beach in my opinion. There are others closer to the hotel too...within 1/2 mile or so. And definitely make it to Santiago's Restaurant (also off the beaten path)...our favorite place on the island! Overall we had a wonderful experience here and I would recommend the Hyatt to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of thefts on lower level and poor management”
Reviews.Author: akpilk
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it as honest as possible. My friend is an owner in Hyatt. For a timeshare property, quiet, nice pool, clean, spacious condos. That's as far as it goes. I was there with my family and best friends family in 2 condos next to each other. We were on the first floor. We were obviously cased by a theft ring as my best friend was robbed in broad daylight as soon as we left her for a few hours (alone with her 2 twin 1 year olds). She left the room for an hour to go to the grocery store and when she came back, all of her valuables were GONE! Besides the fact that the theives took a significant amount of property (including wedding ring, jewelry, computer, ipod, camera, cash), the manager of the property did NOTHING to console her fears. He did not even respect her enough to have contact with her and apologize face to face or offer to move her. When she tried to speak with him directly, he refused to discuss with her and treated her like she was the criminal. I was there to support her and he refused to let me stay with her. I refused to leave as we both felt he was trying to intimidate her as her husband was not there. If your sliding glass door is broken upon arrival, request another room as that is how they are set up to get in. We ended up leaving early as we were being treated unfairly and quite rudely. Feel free to stay at this property and as long as nothing bad happens and you require the help of management, than I guess your stay might be uneventful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jeez
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and (young adult) daughter stayed at the Windward Pointe for 3 nights Jun 5-8. The first thing I was happy about was how large the condo was. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath. The bedrooms are very separate, one being at the front & one at the back. So they offer a lot of privacy. The kitchen is beautiful, has a d/w. There was also washer/dryer which was great to leave with clean clothing. There were 3 TVs, even though we never watched them. Balcony was spacious with seating for 4. You are near the airport but it hardly seems used because only once in a while did we hear any airplanes. You are right across the street from the water where there is a sidewalk for biking, running, walking, etc. When you follow that sidewalk you end up at Smathers beach, which wasn't too far at all. The condo was very clean, housekeeping came everyday. Pool area was beautifully landscaped and pool was clean. Oh, almost forgot, if you go to the Hyatt that is near Mallory Square (forgot the name of it), you get 15% off your breakfast bill and they will validate your parking which we did use because parking was very hard to come by. The only Cons were: No restaurants or shopping areas near the condo that you could walk to. You do need a car or I guess take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay in awesome accomodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dangwidget
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in May 09 at Windward Pointe. We had four adults in our party (which included two girls in their early 20â€™s). The time-share accommodations are quite spacious with two bedrooms, two baths, a kitchen, living area and outdoor balcony with ocean view. The grounds are well maintained, the views are beautiful and everything was very neat and clean. There was â€˜tidy upâ€™ housekeeping which emptied trash, replaced towels, and made beds. The units had a washer and dryer in each unit which was very convenient. The kitchens are well stocked with appliances and utensils which came in handy for breakfasts and snacks. We found the resort to be quiet, uncrowded and perfect for us. The ocean is right across the street from the resort and the views from the balcony were beautiful. A WW II battleship was sunk to make an artificial reef one morning while we were there and we watched the entire thing from the pool. The location near the airport did not cause us any problems. Planes are not going in or out of this airport very often and the ones that do are generally small but we did see and hear some when at the pool. You could not hear planes inside the unit. But I should note that we also heard and saw airplanes when we were in the Duval Street area and other areas of Key West so this does not seem to be limited to this side or area of Key West. We happened to like the location away from the craziness of Duval Street. We rented a car and used it to get where we wanted. There is plenty of free parking at the Windward Pointe and we did not have any problem finding parking in the Duval Street area either. We drove to the Duval area every evening for dinner and to enjoy the entertainment at Mallory Square. We also went to Fort Zachary a few times. We participated in much of what Key West has to offer â€“ jet skis, parasailing, Hemingway house, etc and we drove to everything effortlessly. Some guests we spoke with mentioned using a cab or bus to get around and it would be nice if the Windward Pointe would offer shuttles like many other accomodations do. We used the pool at the resort often and it was not crowded. There were plenty of chairs and lounges available every time we were there. The pool area was fairly quiet but when the iguanas that live on the property made an appearance, they would cause a commotion. There is a snack bar near the pool named Abbey Road. They served 2 for 1 drinks during Happy Hour every day 3-6 PM. Wireless internet was complimentary which must be a change after reading some older posts. The office staff was adequate. These are time share units but we were never pressured to attend a sales pitch. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good experience - would return even though far from town”
Reviews.Author: Babyblues72
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare members and exchanged a week for the Windward Pointe. I was a bit nervous after reading some reviews and actually called the hotel to ask about where our room would be located (in regards to the airport). The room was very clean and we found it well appointed. I had everything that I needed - hairdryer, iron and board, a washing maching and dryer in the room, a full kitchen (perfect for coffee and breakfast on the balcony). There was even a telescope in the room for star gazing - nice touch! Yes - the hotel is far from the main attractions, but we drove down from Miami so we had a car. We did not have trouble finding parking on side streets in town - not once. Yes - you can hear the airplanes - but they didn't start too early and we were out and about during the day (we don't sleep in). I didn't hear planes not once during the night. The front desk staff was always pleasant and willing to help. There's one computer offering free internet service in the lobby. Across the street from the hotel is a nice walk along the water - very nice for morning or evening strolls. There's also a beach that isn't far from the hotel either (however I forget the name). Overall it was a very nice experience - I would definitely recommend it. The only complaint that I have is that we couldn't find someone to join us on our trip - what a waste of a perfectly good 2nd bedroom!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel...Nice retreat”
Reviews.Author: DaynaB
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West on 4/23. We spent three nights at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. It is a small timeshare property with 7 buildings of 2 bedroom condos. Each unit has 2 baths as well. The balcony was very spacious and had a telelscope. We had a first floor room that looked out over the sand volleyball court, and pool area. It is a small pool, but well maintained. Music played at the pool most days. It was not crowded and we never had trouble finding a spot in the sun. The weather was warm, but windy. We went in the hot tub one night. It was pretty large and the water was hot. It says it closes at 10pm, but I think if you are quiet, no one will kick you out. The staff were not as attentive as in the Hyatt Coconut Plantation, in Bonita Springs, FL. The girl behind the front desk did not give us a whole information package, and we kept having to call with questions, like what were pool hours? I understand she was in training, but I didn't see anyone training her. It became a little frustrating. It was easier to get a cab if you walked outside yourself and hailed one, than to have the staff get you one. Some people have mentioned a shuttle service at the hotel. There is no shuttle. It is the public bus across the street. We did not use it. We took a cab 2 days. It was $4.50 per person each way, if there were 4 people in the cab. In total it was $20 each way. On the evening I decided to drive, another couple had told us about a public lot on Greene and Simonton, where you could park for $10 all day. You could easily walk to Duval from here. it is way too far to walk to town from the hotel. It was Conch Republic Independance week in Key West, and there was a lot of activity, like parades and mock battles at sea. This place is like no other. My sister in law described it in 3 words..."never never land". You truly never have to grow up. The bars were packed, and they had live bands/ singers in almost every one. We had so much fun. We did a sunset cruise with Fury. There were drinks and music. It was great. We spent time at Hogs Breath, Sloppy Joes, and mostly at Irish Kevin's. All have a fun atmosphere. The Hyatt was well equippped, and perfect for 2 couples or a family. We stopped at the Publix on the island and stocked up on a few necessities. It is a nice, clean store. The housekeepers will remove your garbage and replace your towels everyday. Don't keep your garbage outside your room. We saw a baby racoon and one of the landings, picking through someone's garbage. There is a small snack stand and an area with BBQ grills. We did not use them, but if we were there for more than 3 days, we probably would have. We liked the hotel, but would probably choose to stay closer to town next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but far from town”
Reviews.Author: Milly113
Reviews.Content: My parents own a Hyatt timeshare in AZ and thought it'd be nice if we all took a trip to Key West. I chose this particular Hyatt based on the positive reviews. Overall, it was a gorgeous property-beautiful landscape, views, and rooms. The condo type property had two bedrooms and two full bathrooms. There is a full kitchen with everything (even sponge and dish washing soap). The master bedroom is great with a large tub, double sinks, and separate shower and toilet. There is also a washer and dryer in the room. We loved sitting on our balcony and looking at our view of the pool and ocean. I've read that the airplanes fly infrequently and people don't hear them. That is mainly true if you are inside your room. However, if you are outside at the pool, they are loud and you can hear them every 15-20 minutes at times. Yes, they are smaller planes, but I still found them to be slightly annoying, if trying to relax. I believe someone stated that they stop after 8 pm, but I heard some leaving after 9 pm. It wasn't the worst thing, just something to consider. The pool area was nice with a small snack shack that serves sandwiches, salads, and drinks. Although the pool area was pretty, there weren't enough chairs for everyone. Considering how big the property is, you would think they'd put out more chairs. If you weren't at the pool early, you wouldn't get a chair. Also, people would lay there towels on chairs in the morning to save their spots and not return until the afternoon. I didn't think this was fair and thought it should've been discouraged by the staff. I was aware that the hotel was at the opposite end of the island. It wasn't difficult to get to town. There are taxi's (pricey) and a bus ($2) that can get you there. My husband and I are in our early 30's, so we would have liked to be closer to the action, however my parents were fine with the location, and loved the property. Overall, it's a beautiful, updated, and clean hotel. The planes and pool chairs aren't big issues, but I will probably stay at a different hotel next time I'm in Key West, just to be closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Best place on the Island”
Reviews.Author: BH7832
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start. Just returned from 3 glorious nights at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. I have been going to KW for about 12 years and loved this place better than any other I have stayed at or visited. I guess I will start with the negative comments about this place by previous posters. 1) It is on the opposite side of the island from Duval Street. That is true, but it is also quiet, safe and beautiful. A cab is only $20, including tip, and if you rent a car, we had no troubles finding parking. 2) Airport is indeed next door, but planes are only flying during daytime, and quite infrequently. In fact it is pretty cool to see them so low. No big planes here. 3) Some rooms are close to the street, but it is not that busy a street and especially at night. For both the street and the airport, the rooms are well sound proofed. 4) The beach is down the street. If you are going to Key West for the beachs, you started ill informed. KW beachs are never good. Now onto the irrefutable stuff. The rooms are beautiful, modern, big and comfy for 4 adults (2 couples). The decks, which all look on the water are huge (4 chairs around a table, plus 2 rocking chairs). The grounds are very well manicured and beautiful. The pool is fun, with its zero edge. Lots of shady spots, but also lots of sunny spots, including the heavily desired spot right at the street, across from the ocean. The hot tub was actually hot and big enough for a crowd. Abbey Road, the pool bar, was convenient, the staff was very pleasent and the food was phenomenal at a very reasonable price. A Loaded Burger (1/2 lb, cheese, mushrooms, onions, bacon) came with chips for $8 and was one of the best burgers I have ever had. They even have 2 for 1 happy hours from 3-6 on beer, wine and frozens. This is also a time share, but not once did anybody try to make a pitch to us. Although it might have been hard to say no. It has a well stocked full kitchen AND they do daily service in the rooms. Bottom line, if you don't mind the distance from Duval, it is the best in Key West for a couple, a family or 2 couples in our case.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyGirlnxtdoor
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivered everything it said it would. The layout, location and service of the staff was wonderful. Beautiful pool, beautiful rooms and a beautiful view of the ocean. The great feature of every room is the very large balcony, with table, chairs, and telescope that can keep you mesmerized while overlooking the ocean(the outdoor massage on the balcony didn't hurt either). The one minor flaw is that it is next to the airport, however, the occasional plane that took off was actually entertaining while relaxing at the pool. This is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 4-Rent
Reviews.Content: We are Hyatt Vacation Owners, and we were pleasantly surprised with our stay at this Hyatt. The weather was beautiful! Sunny 80s days and mid 60s at night. The rooms were somewhat smaller than we usually have, but were very nice and well kept. It was just right for our family. This location is private and a little secluded from the hustle and bustle of Duval street.. and we loved it! Our room overlooked the ocean, and my kids loved the telescope. The only down side to me was that there were not a lot of activities on the property for kids. But they enjoyed playing pool, shuffle board, and swimming during our down time. There are lots of water activities to do and beaches to visit off property. We have a great stay there and we will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Planes, Harleys, Spring Breakers, Thin Walls - Consider the noise factor when booking”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountaintravel
Reviews.Content: Let me say at the outset that we are Hyatt Vacation Club owners (though not at this location) and have visited a number of Hyatt's properties. Based on reviews we expected that this would be one of our more favorable such experiences. However, this property has some serious shortcomings and room location clearly will affect your overall experience. Also, the photographs available from the property do not reveal what is essentially a motel-like quality to the resort and the almost institutional feel about the place. And, as others have noted, the placement of the balconies right next to one another will bring you in close contact with those in adjoining units, maybe closer than you'd like! Despite our request for a top floor unit in a quiet location made in advance of our showing up and the resort manager's written communication that our request would be honored, we were advised that none were available and instead were placed in a second floor unit right next to the 4 lane road that separates the Hyatt from the water (note - there is no beach here). We were assured that we'd love the location and especially the round balcony which is larger than the others. While the balcony/porch is lovely, our time there was limited due to the traffic noise directly below us (this may have been accentuated because apparently the first week of March is "Harley Week" in Key West and there were an overwhelming number of them on the roads) and for some of the time, the partying spring breakers in a unit above us. Which leads me to another point -- whatever construction standards existed, they are not sufficient to mute noise from the units next door and above you. (We've not noticed that in Hyatts in Colorado, for instance.) You hear toilets flush, people walking around, drawers and cabinets closing, TVs on and as I said, if you happen to have noisy neighbors on balconies/porches next to or above yours, you will hear them inside your unit with the windows closed. And don't be lulled into thinking that the airplanes taking off at the airport next door will not be heard -- you will hear them if you are outside, though at least they do not take off late at night or too early in the morning. Speaking of early morning though, what's with the lawn mowers and hedge trimmers starting work at 8 AM? Anyhow my advice to those booking here -- steer clear of building 8 and try to get into a third floor unit. I'm sure other guests had a much more positive experience than our family did, but I feel that it is only fair to report accurately what happened to us. As for the accommodations, they are fine in terms of furniture, kitchen supplies, and linens though nothing extraordinary and certainly not luxury. Housekeeping was virtually non existent (unlike other Hyatt vacation clubs where you get your bed made and general pick up on a daily basis) and the $35 split week cleaning fee seems out of line. The front desk staff was, as others have noted, not much of a help either with room assignment or with quieting the late night partiers. Despite this, we did enjoy our time in Key West. Since we figured we can sit at a pool in other places, we decided that we'd spend most of our time exploring this interesting and beautiful community. We had no problem finding parking in town and made trips in town one or more times a day to walk around the picturesque streets and to enjoy some incredible food. While all our meals were good, we particularly enjoyed Seven Fishes, Blue Heaven for lunch, and 915 Duval for tapas. We took a drive out to Hogfish Bar and Grill for a terrific lunch on the dock. Because we really liked Key West and plan to return, we went to visit the Beach House Hyatt and after a tour there we decided that will be our choice the next time around even though it is a more dated facility. While at Windward Pointe we enjoyed having a nice walk way right across the street for our morning walks, the trade offs with the noise and unpredictable neighbors aren't enough to bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveln0w
Reviews.Content: Okay, I have been using Trip Advisor for years and have never provided a review. I have decided it is time to do my part. My husband, sister and I stayed at this Hyatt in January. It is always difficult to find a good place for three people to stay that still provides a little privacy. The standard accommodations here are a two room two bath suite with a full kitchen, dining area, and living room leading to a balcony/ patio. We paid $225/night + tax which was cheaper than paying for two rooms elsewhere, and we had a full kitchen which saved us money since we were able to cook some of our meals. We picked up provisions prior to checking in as there is no nearby grocery store. We then dropped our rental car off at the airport as you donâ€™t really need one in Key West as I will explain. However, parking is free at the hotel if you do have one. The Hyatt Windward Pointe is located just east of the Key West airport and four miles from Duval St. I can confirm as stated in other reviews, air traffic noise is not a problem; it is not a busy airport. The hotel is located on Roosevelt Blvd. which separates the hotel from the beautiful blue waters of the Gulf. FYI, there is no beach in front of the hotel which is probably just as well as it reduces the homeless population that would otherwise be hanging out there. Roosevelt Blvd. seems like it should be a busy road, but surprisingly it really isn't. A wide pedestrian/bicycle path (separate from the road) follows the water into town. I thought long and hard about the location before I booked the hotel. It is four miles from Duval Street, the center of the action. However, I can say that it was nice to retreat to our quiet hotel away from the center at the end of the day. Being four miles from Duval, you may ask how we handled the transportation issues. We do like to walk, and we did walk into town some of the time. However, for people who don't like to walk, the bus stops right outside the hotel and runs about every hour. Taking the bus is fast, and you don't have to hassle with parking near Duval St., or worry about who the designated driver will be. The hotel gave us a black and white copy of the bus schedule which wasn't great given the bus lines are named Blue, Green, Red etc. We had better luck picking up a schedule at the Key West Information center near Mallory Square. The taxis are ridiculously expensive so we didn't bother with them. Our room was located on the second floor and had a spacious balcony that gave us a great view of the Gulf (and the shuffle board area). It appeared that every room has the same great view. A telescope was provided, but I can tell you that as an optics person, it was pretty low quality. You might be able to get a slightly better view of a passing boat, but forget trying to look at the stars. We took advantage of the wonderful pool on multiple days. Sometimes it was a little too full of kids, but it was a big pool. There was a bar/cafÃ© place next to the pool, but we didnâ€™t buy anything. Since we did cook in our room I can warn you that the smoke alarm will go off even if you are not burning anything. Yes, there was a sign on the microwave recommending one use the vent fan, but I kind of missed it. The friendly Hyatt staff knocked on our door to ensure that we were not burning the place down. The beds/bedding/furniture/cleanliness etc, were as expected for a good Hyatt, no complaints. The service was perfunctory, but adequate. We were taking the Key West Express boat to Fort Myers at 6pm on our last day and asked if we could store our luggage at the other Hyatt near the boat terminal. They called and made the arrangements. By the way, our 6 pm boat departed at 5:30 pm, you canâ€™t be late. We either ate in our room or near Duval street. The only restaurant nearby the Hyatt is a Benihanas, and there is no restaurant within the hotel. We ate at two great restaurants in town. The first was El Siboney which is a wonderful inexpensive Cuban restaurant. The other place we liked was Santiagoâ€™s Bodega â€“ excellent tapas! Blue Heaven was decent, but I would go to Santiagoâ€™s. We took a bicycle tour with Lloyds. Loved the stop at the secret garden/ parrot rescue place (Nancy Forresterâ€™s Secret Garden), but was otherwise unimpressed with the tour. It was nice to sample unusual fruits, but there was no discussion of the history or architecture of Key West, and the bikes sucked! Instead, definitely make a stop at Nancyâ€™s Garden and check out the many parrots who will chat with you. Key West is just a great place, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Mom5Chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, but not at all what is shown in the photos. Location: It is right next to the airport and faces a road. Across from the road is a seawall and the ocean is beyond that. I was a bit surprised to find that it was so close to what a main road on Key West (Roosevelt Rd.). If you can get past the planes flying overhead and the road in front of the hotel, its actually not a bad place. It has ping-pong, shuffle board, a nice pool and a volleyball court with sand. The patios are also very large. Rooms: Very nice. No complaints here. Maid service: Relatively good. They make the beds each morning, load the dishwasher and take out the garbage. Service: The front desk staff were clueless. I asked to move my room, and they were indifferent about it. The concierge was not very accommodating. Very few recommendations were offered in terms of activities and restaurants. I had to do the legwork myself. Overall, our stay was OK and the hotel room was well worth the $225 rate, but it is not a luxury property or a first rate property. It is simply an OK place to stay with your family if you plan to be out and about town enjoying Key West. The rooms are clean, well appointed and roomy, but location definitely matters within the hotel. When booking your room, ask for buildings 4 and 5, which seem to be set a bit further back (near the front desk) and aren't subject to the road noise.

Reviews.Title: “So-so weather and still worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Bert_PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe in Key West from a Friday to Monday morning in Feb 2009. The room was great, well appointed with all the necessary amenities with maybe the exception of a pizza slicer. Service was as expected, but we didn't expect much with this location since it is a time share resort. The front desk check-in was painless and offered some useful basic information and a map. The check-out process was a breeze that took less than 30 seconds. The resort sits on a main road, that is oddly not that busy. Across the street is a very wide walk way which rests on a ocean wall (no sand/beach). The on site pool, hot tub, volley ball court were great. It was unseasonably cool (mid 60's to low 70's) so the pool was mostly out of the picture, but was nice for the few hours we had in the low/mid 70's. The on site snack bar was sufficient (the full blown Hyatt restaurant is at the other Hyatt location across town near Duval). The island "entertainment" itself was enjoyable. We spent every evening on Duval street strolling through the shops and deciding which restaurant to eat at. We first tried a Cheeseburger joint which we did not even remotely enjoy. The service was fine, even good, but the food was horrible. Mushy fish and a "grey" chewy hamburger - yuck! Needless to say that experience turned us off from the local fare for a bit. We also visited the Hard Rock Cafe (very good), and a place called Fogerty's (very good - best potatoe soup ever!) There was also a very good ice cream joint a few blocks down Duval (non-chain). I don't recall the name, but it was on the street with a white little fence separating it from the street and some bar style seating. With a 2 yr old and another sub 21'er, we didn't participate in any of the wild night scene. There were however plenty of bars which seemed to be quite popular. Random thoughts/things I remember -The train tour was $29 a person for 1.5 hr tour - we passed on it. -The best beach (read no homeless sleeping in the sand) was Ft. Zachery State Park. Well worth the fee to enter (based off car occupancy or walking/biking in...it's gated so you'll likely need to pay unless super sneaky). I think the cost was around $1.25 / person. It is slightly hidden, so just follow the coast or find maps/directions. It took us awhile to find the actual entrance. -There are bicycles & scooters/mopeds _everywhere_ -There is a fair number of homeless, you'll see them on the more popular corners offering to take your picture, playing music, making things from palm leaves, or simply sleeping on the open beaches. They are however mostly harmless, of the 20-30 we saw, only one even attempted to ask for money. -There are pink taxis all over - pointless, but funny -There is a drag queen bar/club who promotes their club by driving a convertible white car down Duval every night around 8-9pm throwing beads to the crowd and stopping for pictures with requesting travelers. Even with a family we didn't feel uncomfortable however. -In the NE USA we have squirrels, Key West... they have chickens. Yes - roosters were all about the non beach/non Duval street areas cockadoodle-doing and running in front of our car. -The Hyatt was too far from any "nice" beaches to walk, but a bike for a bit older family would have worked just fine. -The small Key West airport was right next to the resort, but unless you were actually at the pool during the day (and not at the beach?) you would never know it. Mostly small prop planes, with a handful of small jets. Didn't notice a single takeoff/landing past 8pm. Overall, well worth the trip. We had a promotion rate on the Hyatt Windward but I could see it being worth $400 or so otherwise. If we had paid more than our sub $200 price tag I would have expected an onsite restaurant and a real concierge. Last but not least, the sales pitch was rescheduled due to staff cuts, which was rather annoying. In the end however the Hyatt time share rep (Marius) was quite pleasant and non pushy. Had we been able to remotely afford it (half our trip was free due to credit card points or gifts from relatives), we would have likely purchased a time share through him. In all, it took 90 minutes and was quite informative.

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Dockpotato
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Hyatt Windward Pointe and could not have been more pleased. The suites were spacious, clean, very comfortable and modern. The staff was most pleasant and always helpful. All of my stays away from home should be in a property of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: mazeyday
Reviews.Content: My brother and I had a very nice time staying at this "time share" resort. Actually the only problem we had is that we booked on expedia, and after we checked in I called the front desk to ask if we could have a unit with a balcony not quite so exposed to the common walkway, and at that point I feel like I was treated like a second class citizen for "booking online", as the front desk person put it, and couldn't be moved to another unit, because I had "booked online". It turned out not to be too bad, and I'm glad I didn't waste my energy making a stink over it, the reality is, all the units there have balconies that are quite exposed to balconies of other units, not very private. I have to say, even though the balconies are not very private, we still had a great time at this resort, and definitely will want to stay there again, when we return to Key West. The Pros: --Very Clean units, I even walked around the unit in my bare feet, which I never do in a hotel!! --Very well stocked units, my brother and I said how we and even more guests could easily have stayed a week and relaxed and enjoyed ourselves, we were sad we were only staying four nights. There are lots of dishes, glasses, flatware, and other kitchen necessities, such as blender, toaster, food processor, coffee maker, it was great! --Large balconies/lanais, even though they are not very private, meaning you can see a lot of other balconies from yours, and smell cigarette smoke from people smoking on their balconies in the early morning, the balconies are large with nice tile floor, a nice dining table with four chairs and two comfortable wicker rocking chairs. It looked to me like you could see the ocean from all the balconies, and there is a telescope, although I was never able to use it very well. --The bed in the second bedroom was a queen and I thought not very comfortable (too hard for me), there is a king in the master suite. The master suite opens directly into a bath with two sinks, a clean looking jacuzzi tub, and a separate toilet room and separate shower stall. Both bedrooms had a decent sized closed, a tv, and a luggage rack. Very comfortable, other than the beds not being super comfie. --I loved the pool at this resort, felt and smelled clean, although didn't have an obvious chlorine smell, was large enough to proving private areas for different people to swim, we very much enjoyed the pool, especially at night when no one else was there, I think the hours were 8am to 10pm. --There is no restaurant or room service, as this is a condo resort, you certainly could prepare anything you want in the full kitchen, only thing I noticed missing was a pizza cutter. There is a snack and drink bar by the pool that is open only till 6pm with a quite limited menu, we never used it so I can't comment on the offerings. --There is a huge green iguana that wanders around the property, that is fun to keep track off, there are two shuffle board courts which we found fun to play on the way too and from the pool. --Note, for anyone arriving in the evening and wanting to get some groceries, the front desk dork told me about a Publix, that was already closed, thanks a lot dips..t, come to find out there is an Albertson's on North Roosevelt Highway open 24 hours, I found out while buying 50 bucks worth of groceries at the gas station...so embarrasing. You would think an evening front desk person at a resort in a tourist town would be able to tell you about the 24 hour grocery store when you arrive at 8pm hmm, maybe next time. --Location...so funny, my biggest reservation in reserving this resort was the fact that it is a four mile drive from downtown, making driving in to town necessary, and I read how you can never find any parking in town. Sweet surprise for me, we parked easily in town, three different days, these were in mid October, so I don't know about all seasons, but I found parking every day within 5 minutes and just had to feed the meter a couple bucks of change. Also, my brother and I both found it very refreshing to drive back to "the quiet side of the island" at the end of the day, and back to our nice resort, after being in the touristy bluster of downtown Key West for the afternoon. Ironically I found the one thing I thought I wouldn't like about the resort, the location, to be surprisingly refreshing! I would definitely recommend this resort, although I would caution that in my opinion, not more than four people would be comfortable in any given two bedroom suite. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxing Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BooDoodle
Reviews.Content: We booked our unit through "rentmytimeshare.com". This website is an avenue that owners can use to rent or sell their timeshares. We had a good experience with the site because you are in direct contact with the owner. The Hyatt Windward Pointe is a very nice Key West resort. Every unit is two bedroom two bath with full living room and kitchen. The pool is nicely sized for the resort with a hot tug, sand volleyball court, shuffle board, pool table, pool side bar, and areas for grilling. The unit was very clean with no problems with anything. We were ocean side with a great clear view of the ocean. This resort is within walking distance to the Key West airport. At first I was a little concerned with noise. After a day there I realized it is not any issue. The airport is small so the only air traffic is a few small jets and turbo prop planes. The airport has the same schedule everyday and air traffic is minimal. The Hyatt is on the ocean across a two lane road. There is not a beach. However, there is a nice walking path that goes for a couple miles along the ocean wall. It is walked, jogged, and biked by many people everyday and night. It is a mile walk to Smathers Beach. Duval Street is about 3 miles. Having a car is important at this resort. Parking in Key West was not bad at all. We never had a problem finding a spot within a couple blocks of Duval Street. The resort is a timeshare and someone will ask you for your time to go over the plan. We politely declined and went on our way. We were not bothered at all. The resort also brings in local businesses once a week to talk about their tours. We found this to be a great opportunity and took advantage of some of the great offers. We found the Hyatt Windward Pointe to be a very nice relaxing resort. The staff were polite and the pool side bar guys were great. The ocean view from the pool was great, the morning walks along the ocean walkway were great. The unit was great. We would definately go back. We also went diving, snorkeling, golfing, and took a drive up to Bahia Honda State Park. Also, we found a great little beach on Key West called Fort Zachary Taylor State Park. Nice beach, some snorkeling, outstanding sunsets. Best place for sunset pictures by far. Email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: hhvdragon
Reviews.Content: We also got a great rate for sitting through the time share presentation. I strongly recommend considering it. We had three nights for about the price of one night. The property is not really within walking distance of the Key West attractions, but there are several transportation options. First you can pay for a private shuttle company which leave from the hotel on the hour. You can use this as many times as you want each day. Secondly, taxis are always around. And, lastly, if you are planning to take the Old Town Trolley tour there is a pick up location right next door at the Best Western. That is a great tour for somebody who has never been to Key West and will provide you with a way to get almost everywhere. The property itself is beautiful. It wasn't really as big as the pictures made it look, but the view was spectacular and the rooms are very nice. We had a two bedroom, two bath with a full kitchen and living room. It even had a huge lanai with a view of the pool and the ocean, and a telescope!! The beds were very comfortable and the property as a whole seemed very quiet and peaceful. The pool was a bit warm but, hey, Key West in the summer. One tip- bring bug repellant. I came back covered in bites (from being outside, not in the rooms). If you do the time share thing, make sure to get your coupons early and use them up before you leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation in lovely Key West”
Reviews.Author: blackterrier
Reviews.Content: This proved to be a great stay for 5 nights during our Florida vacation.Our suite was huge with two good sized bedrooms and a large lounge with very well equipped kitchen. Our balcony looked out over the sea and even had its own telescope. Everything was spotlessly clean and housekeeping each day was thorough. The hotel is in a quieter part of Key West which to some may be a bit out of the way but we preferred to stay here away from the mayhem of Duval Street. There is no restaurant but the shuttle took you to downtown Key West to sample all the reatarants there. ps The Seaplanes of Key West to the Dry Tortugsa was excellent and well worth the expense - great snorkellingand the airport is just beside the Windward Point.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: oldpunk
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate in exchange for sitting through a no hassle two hour timeshare sales presentation. Accommodations were very spacious; well maintained; and clean. Lots of natural light. Kitchen had plenty of new cooking utensils, dishes, etc. Furnished covered balconies faced the ocean. Across the street there was a long and wide sidewalk on the ocean if you like to take morning or evening jogs or walks. Out of the hustle and rif-raff of downtown, but only a three or four minute drive away. Nice breeze usually blowing through. The staff was friendly and attentive. A very quiet property. Airport noise did not seem to bother us. Take lots of quarters downtown as the meters are usually cheaper than parking lots. The metered spaces, while not overly plentiful, were always available. Fort Zachary Taylor Beach is well worth the car admission fee (includes parking) as it is a clean sandy beach with ample shade, showers and restrooms and with interesting rocks to swim around. Also has a fairly inexpensive snack bar with decent food and dining deck. I am usually very critical in my reviews, but I have nothing negative whatsoever to say about this property - it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “3 day trial visit”
Reviews.Author: zocko
Reviews.Content: Had an offer for three days at a discount rate and decidede to try it since we've never been to Key West. Arrived on Sunday 6-1-08 after driving in from Miami airport. 160 miles and three hour drive. Had a second floor unit with two bedrooms and two baths. Lovely room #5322 on the south side facing the court. It was unseasonally hot 90+ . Which made the walking tours a little much. had a rental car and you needed it to go anywhere from here. this is as far away as you can get from Duval St. Found a few $10 parking spots when we looked. Had dinner at the Hyatt downtown the first night and u get three hours free parking in the lot with dinner and a 15% discount with your Hyatt stay. Great food and service. came back for breakfast day three. Service? You get towels. The place is quiet, front desk closes at 11pm. Pool is beautiful. No beach and a view of the Atlantic. Went to the vacation club presentation and was really considering it but can't make up my mind. Any help on that would be appreciated. Visited all four Hyatt locations. Did n't like the beach club. hotel was nice and downtown club was a little smaller and tight. Visited Louie's Back Yard for drinks and then dinner. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “A+ rooms on a C+ property”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 kids (14 & 10) stayed over spring break at the Hyatt Winward Point. Check in was a breeze - and the room was fabulous. All the rooms face the ocean, are huge with a deluxe kitchen, 3 tvs and a telescope for watching stars or boats that pass by. Even though the property and pool were clean and the staff friendly, we still found our overall experience to be average. The drawbacks to this property is it's location and amenities. The nearest beach is 1 mile down the road, the airport is right next to the hotel so airplanes taking off and landing can be heard all day and early evening, the snack bar was OK with sandwiches and hot dogs and beer/drinks, . .but that's it. No in-room movie rentals (the VHS machine in the lobby was all out and only had older movies), no room service, no restaurant on site, no work-out room, no game room, . . .nothing. The room was fabulous - but that's all you get here - everything else, dinner, beach, watersports, entertainment - you have to go somewhere else for. If you are looking for a big room to just relax in with a great ocean view - this is the place. If you're looking to see and expereince any of Key West - this may not be for you. We like the restaurants, shops and activities of Duval Street, so next time we'll be staying somewhere else. Also, the hotel shuttle to the pier is $25/day or $65 for 4 days - per room, and tipping each way is expected. The shuttle runs on the hour - but it was late or full half the time we rode it. We found a pay lot right next to the shuttle drop-off point downtown for $10/day. If you drove to Key West - park yourself - it's cheaper and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Kids never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: julesvanwyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Winward Pointe over Spring Break on a Time-Share Promo. We can't wait to go back. The 2 bedroom condo was perfect for a family with 3 or 4 kids. Everything in the condo was clean, fresh and new, decorated with a warm comfortable island theme. The master suite was beautiful. The kids had their own bathroom and each room had a nice television for the young early risers. The kitchen was gorgeous as were the views out the lanai. The presentation for the Time-Share was 90 minutes and low-pressure. The resort itself was impressive! The pool was huge, clean, and never crowded. There is a pool table, shuffleboard, and ping pong outside by the snack bar which my kids enjoyed. Even though the resort was booked it never seemed busy. It was quiet and relaxing. This is the nicest resort we have stayed at in the keys. We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a fantastic property.”
Reviews.Author: tigerdave
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West although we have always wanted to vist this unique part of Fla. My wife picked this condon complex off the website. The two bedroom, two bath condo was fantastic. Nicely furnished and very functional. Nice large balcony with a view of the water, telescope , and patio furnitrue provided. This property is away from Duval street and in fact faces the Atlantic side of the island. So you enjoy the quiet, laid back atmoshpere of a tropical hotel/condo complex, but c.lose enough to visit the dowtonw area and sunset celebrations. The pool area was great and the staff and patrons were very friendly. This was one of our more enjoyable vacations and we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MarciaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Windward for our Spring Break from March 26 to April 2. My husband and I brought along our teen-age kids (14 year old boy, 16 year old girl) and a friend (15 year old girl). Our condo was absolutely gorgeous. Big deck, tiled floors, immaculate. The kitchen was well-stocked with the basics, and Publix is just a short ride away. The grounds were impeccable. The pool was very nice, and the only thing that would have made it perfect was if it had been oceanfront. We did, however, go to the Hyatt downtown and enjoyed the beach and amenities there. Very nice. We really liked not being close to Duval Street, but enjoyed going there in the 6-seater electric car we rented downtown. The only reason we even needed our rental card was to drive to Marathon to swim with the dolphins. If you're not leaving Key West, I highly recommend the electric cars instead of a rent-a-car. Back to the Hyatt. The staff was very accomodating and every need was met. It is a time-share, but we were never even approached about a tour as is so often the case when you book a time share condo or room. The entire family enjoyed our stay, and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: LikeItWarm
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (parents, 2 teenagers and a 9 year old) recently completed a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Windward Pointe. This was our first trip to Key West, and we took a chance on not renting a car based on other reviews we saw. Other than a bit of a panic the first night we arrived hungry (no restaurants within walking distance and no food in the fridge) we really didn't miss not having a car. We bought the 4 day shuttle pass for $65 and this worked very well for our entire family during our stay. It basically left every hour from the resort and dropped us off right in the middle of the action downtown in about 15 minutes. There was a nearby grocery store to where the shuttle dropped us off, and we stocked up with food and drinks the first morning. They also have quite a few restaurants that delivered to the resort - we ordered Chinese take-out one day and it arrived in 20 minutes! The shuttle drivers were very friendly also. I honestly didn't miss the hassle, stress and cost of driving and parking downtown. We got a chance to meet quite a few friendly people in the shuttle from different parts of the country. One day we rented some bikes and rode up and down the coast. This was really fun, but I wouldn't recommend riding on the downtown streets with small children - there's a lot of traffic and somewhat narrow streets. The resort itself was excellent. The condo was large enough for the 5 of us to all have our own space. The pool was large and kept very clean, and it was very easy to find lounge chairs. Nice volleyball court, ping pong and shuffle board. The Abbey Road snack bar had excellent food and great cooks - very friendly. Their liquor license had been temporarily suspended during our stay which saved us quite a bit on our bar bill! We basically brought our own stuff to the pool that we picked up at the grocery store. Not sure if it was due to the fact that were a nightly rental (not time-share) but we had some pretty good maid service every day - emptying trash, making the beds, replacing the towels. The desk clerks and concierge were very friendly and helpful the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: ugagirly
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at this hotel. Everything was clean and in working order. I'm very particular so that's saying alot! We did not get asked to listen to a timeshare presentation. The pool is nice, plenty of chairs were always available at the pool. The snack shack had good food for a quick bite. The only thing we did not like was the expensive cost of internet at this hotel. They do not have any free internet/computer/business center available either. My husband felt "nickeled and dimed" by the hotel because everything that wasn't in your room cost extra. We got a one day pass for the shuttle $25 and then ended up needing one the next day and they wanted us to buy a weeks long one ($100) when we wouldn't even be there that long instead of letting us have just another day pass. We worked it out though. We tried to get trolley tickets there, but they only had one left and pointed us to the best western where the trolley picks up anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort”
Reviews.Author: Tomby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a time share "deal" so we got a reduced rate. The presentation was not pushy. This is not really a resort. The condos are very nice, although located on a road across from the ocean (no ocean access nearby). There is a pool, and some BBQ grills and a hammock, but no other recreation at the resort. There is a snack bar but no restaurant or other entertainment. The condos themselves were lovely, although if I owned one I'd be annoyed at the lack of outlets for computers etc! This is not walking distance to anything; you need a car or they have a not cheap shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Suburb Key West Resort”
Reviews.Author: TeacherT
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this beautiful Key West resort where we had impeccable accomodations in our 2 bedroom 2 bath unit, with full kitchen,living room and washer and drier. The lovely deck overlooked beautifully landscaped grounds with an infinity pool facing the ocean. Although this is on the quiet side of the island, it was easy to get downtown to where the action was!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: beth69
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a two bedroom condo. We are in the disney points system and traded for this hotel. I will say that this timeshare seems to be a very quiet place. We stayed from Dec 28th through Jan. 3. Since we have young children we decided to stay away from Duval Street at night especially on New Years Eve.
