We were pleasantly suprised how quiet it was on New Years at the resort. The condo was very nice BUT they seemed to have a major problem with sugar ants. They were there when we arrived and after a day of killing some everytime we went by the kitchen we decided to call the front desk. They did send up maintance who sprayed. The ants did stay away for about 2 days but came right back. We were on the third floor so they were coming all the way up. Across the street from the hotel was a nice walkway that you could look down into the ocean. The water was so clear that we say several stingrays, lots of fish, and (what we thought) an small octopus. My daughter loved walking just about everyday! The airport was right beside the hotel. The noise didnt seem to bother any of us. I could not hear it at night and it was actually fun watching them come in during the day. We did go into town during the day and that was fun but traffic and parking was UNREAL!! We finally got smart and paid for the trolley to take us around, although, we had to wait for 3 trolleys because they were always full. That seemed to be a problem that they could have fixed by sending out more. Also, they didnt offer anything to do at the hotel (as far as actvities). We did play ping pong. We didnt eat at the small snack shop. Weather was very warm the first few days but then very cool the last 3 or 4 days. The front desk workers were very pleasant and helpful. Overall the hotel was good but because of the bugs and the weather we left a day early and I would only give this an average rating. We personally would not stay here again. We drove to Fort Lauderdale and went to Sawgrass Mills which was great!! Also, just to note, the beds were extremely uncomfortable and pillows VERY FLAT!! We even added pillows and still were bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: lizrogatz
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 and stayed for 3 nights. We found the accommodations met our needs. We were disappointed that there was no maid service during our stay, but guessing that is because it is primarily a time share facility. We got fresh towels, but no made beds. The pool and snack bar area are clean and nice. The shuffleboard, ping pong and volleyball are great as well. Other than the lack of service we were pleased with our stay. It is a pretty ocean view as well, and about a 10 minute drive to the Duval Street area.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: capegirlz
Reviews.Content: We went in march of 2007 for 4 nights of fun filled sunny days and tropical nights. It was wonderful. The resort is beautiful with a full kitchen. Granite counters and beautiful dinning room and living room that has sliders to a porch with rocking chairs and patio set that overlooks the ocean. The master bedroom has a king bed with a huge jucuzzi a seperate room for bathroom duties and a glass and tile shower souble sinks all custome cabinetry and tile. The second bedroom has a queen bed, tv closet and across from another beautiful bathroom. The beds are all pillowtop mattresses. The only one issue we had is the coffeepot did not work we called the front desk and they has a brand new one sent up ten minutes later. The pool is beautiful and quite large, plenty of lounge chairs with at small snack bar for food and drinks and a pool table as well. We absolutely loved this resort and will be back for sure. Our young daughters loved the activites at sundown every night at Mallery Square at ages 3 and 5 we did not know if they would like Key West but they sure did. The Hyatt is defenitly a great place to spend quality time with family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: swpalm
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently stayed at this propoerty and were blown away! We received a corner room overlooking the courtyard and the ocean and were in awe of this property. The room was very spacious (2 bedroom condo) with the world's largest master bath I have ever seen. Thank goodness the kitchen was fully stocked with every major appliance one needs on vacation. My girlfriends and I kept on complimenting the decor of the room. The only problem we had was that the maintenance department decided to paint the stairs the day we got there which meant we had to walk clear across 2 buidlings to get to the next available staircase/elevator. I would think if they the hotel knew that the painting was going on that they would have placed us somewhere else. Small detail...but nothing that was going to ruin our trip. The pool was spectacular and so was the service!

Reviews.Title: “No Hyatt Touch Here. More Like a Tattoo Convention!”
Reviews.Author: DC_World_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Windward Pointe Resort is an ill-kept property of aging cookie cutter 2-bedroom condos, literally within walking distance of Key Westâ€™s tiny airport terminal. Situated on the southeastern corner of the island, the resort is about a 20-40 minute bicycle ride, depending on traffic, or a $15-$20 cab ride from Old Town Key West. Thereâ€™s something wrong when itâ€™s been over a decade and a property is still struggling to sell time shares. The front desk staff and concierge are all inexperienced, so the place muddles along without much apparent supervision or inspiration. The resortâ€™s clientele is uncouth at best, and the place is really lacking good management. I was surprised Hyatt put its name on the place. There is no room service other than bath towel replacement during your stay, so get used to unmade beds if youâ€™re endeavoring to relax. The two bedrooms are completely disproportionate in size and luxury level. While the master suite has an adjacent large jacuzzi tub, a two-sink vanity and separate commode room and shower stall, the tile was worn, and the dark shower had a foul odor coming from the drain. The whirlpool bath wasnâ€™t sparkling, so I never used it, as after my experiences in the pool and other areas of the property, I decided its filters had likely not been cleaned in some time While the master had a king, the second bedroom on the airport side of the unit had only a double bed and small closet. The second bathroom with a real tub was across the hall from the second bedroom at the unitâ€™s entrance and not very private at all. The kitchen was large and fully stocked, and there is ample dining space for four people at a table. Though all the furniture was old and downright uncomfortable, particularly the living room chairs. The TVs are cheap and antiquated, and the DVD vending machine in the main lobby was broken during my stay. A pleasant bonus was some Tide samples and a full size washer dryer to wash my clothes after biking. The property has a medium-sized freeform pool with 3-5â€™ depths in dire need of painting and even standard maintenance, a small pub called Abbey Road, as the Beatles reportedly came to this area in the 60s, and a billiards and ping pong table adjacent. There is shuffleboard, volleyball, and a lawn swing to round out the outdoor amenities. The other guests during my stay were running dangerously around the pool deck, screaming at young children, or caught up in various PDAs in the pool, rendering it a bit less enjoyable than I had hoped. Tattoos, body piercings, and cigarettes abounded. Palm trees are a nice touch, but the layout of the place is tedious to negotiate, with eight buildings that fan out to insure that the balconies face the Atlantic side. There is reciprocity with the Hyatt Key West Hotel downtown on Front Street, so take advantage of their fitness center, to which you have access by getting a key card from the hotelâ€™s front desk. There are a few worn treadmill and elliptical machines and a bike, along with a stability ball and some stretch cords at the hotel. No weights were available, though a bench was sitting in the middle of the room. The Front Street hotelâ€™s pool is smaller than the resortâ€™s and the â€œbeachâ€� is about a fifteen foot strip of a cove leading to where the boats dock and a â€œraftâ€� with two wooden slat chaises without cushions. There are no private showers outside of guest rooms at the hotel, so you wonâ€™t be able to shower after your workout or swim, unless you want to bring some shampoo and soap to the poolside shower spigot. Itâ€™s such a long way back to the resort that I did that one day just to freshen up for my evening in town. There are bathrooms near the bar on the pool level to change. The Windward Pointe boasts that every unit has an ocean view, and you could indeed look over the property and the adjacent road and see a tad of the Atlantic from the balcony. Thereâ€™s a large esplanade sidewalk that borders the Atlantic with a seawall that runs along the southern part of the island and runs by Smatherâ€™s Beach, a smelly place with trash washed ashore that the locals told me everyone but tourists avoid. The only clean beach on the island is Ft. Zach[ary Taylor] Park, which is situated off the western side of Key West through a gated community known as The Truman Annex, after the presidentâ€™s retreat house, which is situated in its midst. Ft. Zachâ€™s beach is sandy and then rocky in the shallow areas, so dive boots or fins are much appreciated if you have sensitive toes. You can rent snorkel gear and even kayaks at a stand, and concessions and indoor changing rooms and outdoor showers are available. It costs $1.50 per pedestrian or bicyclist to enter, and $3.50 for vehicles. There are fish to see, and the place is full of locals and foreign guest workers, who basically run all the service-oriented businesses on the island. Downtown Key West is full of bars, shops and vendors. Alonzoâ€™s Oyster Bar on Front St. near the Hyatt Hotel property is the best bet I found during my stay. They have half price drinks and menu items from 4-630 daily, and the quality of the seafood and service is superb. Mallory Square performances each evening before sunset are great too. I highly recommend the Danger Charterâ€™s full day snorkeling and kayaking trip, as it was a great outdoor adventure to sail and experience the Keys from the ocean. It was very professionally run, and snacks, lunch and endless beverages from the Waterside Market were on board for our dining and drinking pleasure. Hemingwayâ€™s house is another must-see. Cruise ships empty thousands onto Duval Street during the day, so plan on being out on the water or recreating while the masses are in town. Oh, and the time share presentation wound up being three hours, as I was open-minded, but the sales guy had to ask his manager most of my questions, prolonging the time spent. I don't think anyone breaks two hours though. After four days and three nights on the property, I decided that the place was really populated by and suited for a different demographic than to which Iâ€™m accustomed at Hyatt resorts worldwide. While the promo lodging offer price was right, the distance from downtown, and lack of inexpensive transit thereto, made staying at the Windward Pointe just plain awkward. If you plan to bike, be forewarned that the street lights arenâ€™t always turned on, rendering the pitch black trip along the sea wall a bit treacherous after dark. There is a homeless population that sleeps along the wall between Smatherâ€™s Beach and the Windward Pointe, which I discovered just before my bike almost hit someone near midnight.. Fisherman also hang out there quietly in the dark, so see if you can get a headlight for any bike rental.

Reviews.Title: “We stay one week EVERY year!”
Reviews.Author: IxChel1972
Reviews.Content: My family have been staying at the Hyatt Windward Pointe every year for almost ten years. There's nothing like Key West for a relaxing, stress-free vacation! The Hyatt WP is located at the tip of the island, such that the blue waters of the caribbean are often spotted from the balcony of our mini-condo. We love having a full kitchen! Most days we are scuba diving or creating our own adventures on mopeds, so we make breakfast, lunch, and snacks "to go" in the kitchen. Dinner is too much work- we go out! :-) The staff at the Hyatt WP have always been accomodating for as long as I can remember. The room is lovely and that jacuzzi tub is the perfect therapy for a sunburn!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it......”
Reviews.Author: KarenSMichigan
Reviews.Content: Our daughter moved to Key West last year, so this was our first visit to the area. We were looking for a place to stay for 2 couples. After much research, we made our reservations here. Price wise, it was a little more than getting two rooms at the hotel we were considering and looked to have many more perks than a regular hotel room. When we arrived, the check-in was quick and smooth. The condo was beautiful and just as nice as we had hoped. It was clean and nicely decorated. The kitchen was lovely. Master bath was huge. Loved the balcony and the view (which was very similar to the traveler's photos posted here for this place..... I swear, those folks must've been right next door!). I was a little concerned about the airport being next door, but it turned out to be not a problem at all. The only time we heard the planes was when we were sitting on the balcony, and then it was a quick takeoff and they were gone. When we were inside the condo, we didn't hear them at all. It's a very small airport with not alot of air traffic. There were a couple small issues...... We knew that there would be a charge for internet access, so that wasn't a surprise. (It seems to me that, more often than not, internet isn't free anymore.... And the more expensive the property, the more likely the charge.) It took several calls to get the internet access working for us. It would work for a minute and then shut down. It would be nice to just have it work without having to call the help desk, leave a message, and then wait for them to call you back. We waited.... finally called them back..... they said they hadn't gotten the message. The same thing happened the second day, but at least they did call us back right away. All in all, it wasn't a huge thing..... just annoying. Another thing was that the bed in the master bedroom was a bit soft and probably could stand to be replaced. It also seemed low to the ground (and I'm only 5'3"). It didn't keep me from getting a good nights sleep. I'd rather have a mattress that's too soft as opposed to a very firm one, so it wasn't an issue for me, but might be for someone else. I didn't ask the other couple if their bed was alright and they didn't mention it, so I can't comment on that. We had a rental car, so we drove everywhere and parked in the city garage when we wanted to head to town. When we were checking out and sitting on a bench at the front entrance, a van pulled up and asked if we were waiting for the shuttle going to town. We didn't know there was a shuttle to town!!!!! Again, not a big deal.... we probably would've driven anyway.... but it would've been nice if the staff had shared that information with us at check-in so we were aware of the option. When all is said and done, these were minor things. I would definitely stay there again. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hyatt Windward Pointe to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Runway”
Reviews.Author: Tenr2th
Reviews.Content: Nice accomodations if you don't mind an active airport runway in the rear of the hotel, which is quite audible. Staff was for the birds, unfriendly, unattentive, would not release the key until 3:50 pm, stating "room wasn't ready yet", which was untrue. Got good rate due to Hyatt Vacation Club sales pitch; suffered through that for 2 hours. Rooms were spacious and well decorated. Located at the extreme end of the island which makes it difficult to access all the attractions--be prepared to pay for parking everywhere. No exercise facility at this hotel. No beach either, photos of it are very deceiving. Looks like you can walk right across the street but that's NOT the case. Key West is not for families with children, either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for the Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bgrojean
Reviews.Content: Pro: -For those seeking sanctity from the drunken madness of Duval St. and teenagers on Scooters, this is your place. - Fantastic concierge; not too aggressive on timeshare sales. The recommendations for dinning were on the money. Be sure to see Marius if you stay here. - Includes every possible amenity needed and beyond; well organized. - Gorgeous rooms - very spacious. - Each unit has a view of the ocean (Hyatt is on Atlantic side), they provide a telescope at no charge; fantastic touch of class and creativity. - For timeshare exchanges, this is worth it! Con: - Elevator service was "down for maintenance" during our stay - made it tough to bring up luggage; stairs are not that bad for younger crowd, though they do get slippery after rain... watch out. - Cleaning service does not carry an updated list of guests and check-out dates. If staying for a week beware, they may mistakenly knock on your door early in the morning (9:00 a.m. is early for me ;-) ) on the wrong check-out date... didn't stop knocking until I woke up and answered the door. The cleaning service member was on her cell phone too and quite rude. I assume this service is contracted out and did not take it personally as a lack of quality from the Hyatt themselves. This was the worst part of our stay... obviously not that bad of a complaint regarding severity. - No shuttle service - if you do stay here and wish to park near Duvall, do so at your own risk. Most street spots are residential only; goto Old Town Parking Garage on Grinelle and Caroline ($13.00 all day; not too bad). I would rather have the peace and quiet than a close walk to Duvall. Donâ€™t get me wrong, Duvall is a blast, but thatâ€™s not why we chose Key West for our honeymoon â€“ we chose it because of its natural beauty and easy going lifestyle of those that live on the island. Perfect! I really have no negative things to say about this place. It is perfect for honeymooners and those looking to take in the beauty of Key West minus the frat party on the west side of the island. This coming from a newly married 24 year old as well. Give this place a shot if you can exchange through interval international (time shares). It will definitely not disappoint - fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wireless through the nose”
Reviews.Author: Zulu61
Reviews.Content: Undeniably a very decent resort BUT BE WARNED.. If you go on their site you are informed that they provide Wireless Internet access throughout various places in the facility. You will NOT find anyplace (as of today) on the site that bothers to mention they charge @10.00 per day PER device. That is to say that if you and your spouse both happen to have brought your laptops to pop on check email touch base with work, etc then believe me this adds up quickly. When we asked the Concierge about why it wasn't posted on the website we were told "I'm sorry but it isn't required to be. We post it in the appropriate areas of our facility, and that is sufficient." WHAT a load of crap. To think I was foolish enough to BUY a platinum week unit in this place. Wish I NEVER stopped to talk to the girls in the booth downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: ECFFLKG
Reviews.Content: Loved the property, pool, and grounds. The rooms were very nice and loved the spacious porch area. The construction was noticeable and annoying. We couldn't believe one night when we heard jackhammering at 10:30pm!! Also, they advertise their new wireless internet available...what they don't tell you is that it costs $59.99 for a week's access!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it should be”
Reviews.Author: dbarthel
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 3 nights the first week of June. Upon arrival we were told that the elevator was broken and that we would have to carry our luggage to the 3rd floor - we were reassured that it would be fixed the next day. It wasn't fixed by the time we left. The room itself was lovely - beautiful kitchen and good sized bedrooms. But, the mattresses in both beds were quite uncomfortable - comparable to one you would find on a pull out couch. Apparently they have "daily tidy and towel service" but no one ever came to tidy or make the beds and on the 2nd day of our stay we had to call the front desk twice for someone to bring clean towels to the room. At close to $400 a night, the amenities and service should match the price. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome cannot say enough”
Reviews.Author: windsorcanadian
Reviews.Content: This was our home from may 19-26/07 we could not have felt more at home. As everyone has mentioned construction right infront of the hotel but no big deal and the airport never even knew it was there, true a little far from downtown but all in all you had your chance to relax without to much noise, rooms were great,hotel staff very helpful and as nice as could be. We even made friends with the racoons,if you stay in room 513 we were feeding them so they hung out all week, as for key west oh my god i will be back again and again . Awsome week We came back different people the hotel just says relax no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, location is a liitle far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: irippedmypants
Reviews.Content: Good rooms and nice spot - they are working on rt 1 as everyone has mentioned - not a party spot - family oriented. If you are looking to hang on duval st - this is not the place - but if you have kids - go for it

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationshark
Reviews.Content: Stay at Windward Pointe the first week of March. As others have stated, there is construction on Route A1A. The construction did not stop anyone from going to the pool area. It looks like once they finish the right-hand side of the road, they are going to do the left-hand side of the road. So construction will be there through the rest of this year. The resort is at the end of the Key West Airport. I had been concerned about noise, but to my surprise it wasn't that bad. The planes and small jets take off and are gone very quickly. It is not a busy airport. The suites are very nice. There are two bedrooms, kitchen, dining area and living room area. All floors of the suite are tiled. All suites have a view of the Atlantic Ocean from their balconies. Being on the east side of the island allows one to view the sunrise. We only had to walk across the street to get a spectacular view. The grounds of the resort are very well maintained. There is also a small place by the pool where you can order food and drinks. Their hours are 10AM to 6PM. Happy hour is 3PM to 6PM. We have been told that the resort doesn't cater to the "Spring Break" crowd. I don't know if this is true or not, but closing the bar area at 6PM doesn't allow late night drinking on the resort grounds. The concierge at the resort will arrange off site activities at a discount price. We rented bikes through the concierge and the company delivered the bikes to us. The same goes for scooters. The boating excursions the resort deals with are not the party ones. The only thing within walking distance of the resort is the airport. We found out when we were leaving that there is a lounge at the airport. A beach is about a mile away. We had a rental car so we were able to go to the shopping centers the locals go to and buy groceries. These shopping centers are at a distance of 2 miles and greater. Downtown is 5 miles away. There is a downtown bus that stops in front of the resort every 30 or 60 minutes. If you want to explore the side streets of Key West, then I recommend renting a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - some noise”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Falcon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the first week in March. This is a beautiful resort and the rooms are excellent. Large two bedroom units, two baths, full nicely equipped kitchen and large balcony (Note - balcony is not screened) All areas of the resort were maintained in an outstanding manner. Staff was excellent! Yes, the airport is right behind the resort and you can occassionally see and hear the planes. Not a big deal. The Navy has a pilot training facility on KW so you will also see those planes over the resort. Again nothing bad. However, the road in front of the resort is being made into four lanes and there is construction in front of the resort - almost directly infront of the swimming pool that is near the main highway. Sooner or later they have to finish that section and move on! I would not consider this a kids friendly resort. For more family oriented I would suggest the Hyatt Beach House. Had an execllent meal at Nicole's in the Hyatt Hotel. For parking downtown we used the Hyatt hotel - $12 each time you enter. Meter parking is ten minutes for twenty-five cents if you can find a meter. Public lots ran fifteen dollars. Lots of activities and fun for all. Had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: onthegoVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights the third week in February. The suite was large and beautifully decorated! The master bedroom had it's own bathroom with a large whirlpool bath and a separate shower. The beds were comfortable, everything was very clean and they even supplied the dishwashing liquid, dishwasher detergent and laundry detergent, along with coffee filters! These are items that I did not expect. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and helpful. The covered porch was inviting with comfortable seating, plenty of room to move around and a telescope was provided for each suite so we were able to see the ships on the ocean and even do some star gazing. The only down side to this resort is that it is located directly beside the airport. There was a lot of activity and of course, noise. However, we found it to be bearable and actually enjoyed watching the planes take off. There was also construction directly in front of the resort but this should be complete in the next few months and once done, it will give a better walking area and view of the ocean. So, If you are sensitive to noise then I would not recommend this resort but if you can handle that then this is a great place to stay and even better if you can extend it beyond the 3 days that we had.

Reviews.Title: “American Carribean”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPirate
Reviews.Content: While in Key West in Feb of '04 we were invited to view a new resort. Hyatt's Windward Pointe. The accomodations were fantastic, it was quiet yet there were people around. A beautiful pool with a zero entry and it overlooked the ocean. If you were sitting just right it would look like you were in the ocean. There is a bar/snack shop next to the pool and they also rent outdoor games. The rooms are fully furnished and very well appointed and CLEAN. They even have laundry facilities in each unit. The resort has a concierge that is ready and able to find exactly what you want and make your arrangements for you. Though its located on the NE side of the island, its just minutes away from the action of Duval and much quieter. Within walking distance of Smathers beach. The Bone shuttle even stops in to take you where you want to go. We are going to make Windward Pointe our home in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but beware of construction”
Reviews.Author: DenverKgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, wonderful rooms, beautiful grounds, etc. But please beware! If you are planning on staying here in the near future, there is road construction going on about 20 feet from the actual hotel property. We were disappointed in this discovery when we checked in, hoping to have a couple of relaxing days by the pool over looking the ocean. Instead we didn't even make it out to the pool because of the mind numbing noise from bulldosers, jack hammers, tractors, and any other road construction machine you can think of. We couldn't even sit on our deck because of the noise. It started early morning and continued into mid evening. We did orginally ask if we could cancel our 2 night reservation but because we booked it through expedia we were pretty much tossed around in a circle and although the Hyatt admitted that there was in fact construction going on, since it is not on their property they didn't feel as if they should grant us our request with out charging us for one night. So we did stay. Again very nice hotel, wish they had an actual resturant and a fitness room, but if you are looking for quiet and relaxation I would avoid this hotel until they can tell you the road construction is complete. We did spend one night out of 3 down the street at the Sheraton Suites and really enjoyed the peace and quiet there.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: iluvA7Xforever
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved it there! The rooms were huge and comfortable, I didn't want to leave! It was very clean and refreshing. The pool was awesome! I spent most of everyday I was there at the pool. The balcony was the perfect size and we had a nice view of the courtyard, pool, and ocean. The only thing that was a bit inconvenient was the airport, but it was not THAT bad. When inside the condo, you could not hear it, and when you were outside you eventually got used to the noise. I, being only 12 years old, normally get very homesick at night when I'm not in my home, but here, I was not homesick at all. I slept peacefully, even though I was on the pullout couch. It was only a short drive to where all the action in town was taking place, which we did not mind at all. I can't wait to stay there again, for it was an amazing experience and since I've been there, no hotel I've stayed at has been better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice!”
Reviews.Author: annevictoria
Reviews.Content: I apologize my review is a little late. We stayed at Windward Pointe the 1st week in June. Loved the location and the room. We had a 2BR/2BA room with the balcony facing the ocean. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bed was a little uncomfortable, but that is my only complaint. The staff was very nice and helpful. Also, we didn't have any issues being by the airport - we were never distrubed by the airplanes. We stocked up at the local Publix on food items. The kitchen really came in handy. (They don't provide free coffee in the room but have it in their lobby). Also in the room they have a hair dryer, iron/ironing board, pool towels, dishes, silverwear and a telescope! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ghen13
Reviews.Content: My husband and 14 yr old daughter spent a week at the end of March '06 at the Hyatt Windward Pointe Hotel. They loved the unit, had no problem with soaps/shampoos being replaced daily (as someone did in a recent post). The airport being close by was not a problem-- they were out during the day and the plane noise stopped around 10pm so they slept in peace & quiet. Only one thing- we had requested a room with a rounded balcony and when I called to confirm before their visit I was assurred they were booked into just such a room, but upon their arrival it was not a room with a rounded balcony and they had to lean over the railing to get a view of the ocean. It is a pricey place to stay so we felt those two items could've been handled better. Other than that they were happy with the service, cleanliness, accomodations in general.

Reviews.Title: “Our reaction: You've got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: sedelman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our first visit to Key West. There are some very nice things about the resort -- it's a new property, the grounds are very well cared-for, and the condominium-style suites are certainly well set up for a family vacation. But there were some real drawbacks which startled us: Water pressure so low that one of the two showers was inoperable. Spotty electricity, with no generating capacity -- one day it was out for more than 3 hours. No beach even though it's by the water (not unusual in Key West, I have to admit, but not exactly what it seemed from the photo.) Real stinginess in replacing basic supplies. Kitchen utensils which, in some cases, actually fell apart. We liked the room, the balcony with a view of the water, etc., but for the money, and from Hyatt, we expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Chamoeda
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect. Originally booked at the Inn at Key West but due to hurricane damage had to re-book and boy am I glad I chose the Hyatt Windward Pointe. Wasn't sure about the proximity to the airport but the planes only flew during the day and they didn't bother me at all. This time-share condo was clean, comfortable and had all the amenities of home including a dish washer, oven, hob, washing machine, dryer and a jaccuzi which was big enough for two. The whole appartment was furnished in the style of Hemingway with very tasteful decor. The only one flaw in the whole set-up was that due to the hurricane the ceiling fan on our balcony was not working properly but that was a minor detail. We had a beautiful view out onto the gardens and the Atlantic even though we were placed well back and on the ground floor. The kids loved the fact that there were 3 tv's and that they had their own room and bathroom without having to sleep in a seperate appartment. There was also a telescope for our use and we managed to take a lovely photo of the moon. The Hyatt is for people who want to get away from all the cruise ships and tourists who seem to take over Duval Street and the down town area. There was a shuttle service from our condo to the town which we didn't use as we had a hired car but the parking is very expensive so it is a great option. The best beach on the island "Smathers Beach" is within 1 mile and is worth the walk. In short the Hyatt Windward Pointe Resort gets a first class report from me and my family and we will definately be revisiting in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the condo-style two-bedroom suite for a week, and this Hyatt has set the standard against which all other vacation accomodations will be judged. It has everything you will need in your home-away-from-home including washer and drier, dishwasher, microwave, three TVs which will take video in from your source (laptop, video camera). True, it is on the other side of the island from the nonstop party. In exchange, it is much more peaceful... and you are likely to do your vacation shopping at Albertsons instead of an overpriced street market. Get a scooter; it is the best way to see the island and makes Duval Street a 10-minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, classy, spacious, contemporary”
Reviews.Author: hoteljunkies
Reviews.Content: This Resort was perfect for our family of 6 (my parents, 2 little kids, my wife, and myself) during this trip. It is rare to find a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, with a kitchen - especially one that is as elegant as this. The kitchen was first rate, with the granite countertops and beautiful floor tiles. The dining table and the rest of the furniture was very tasteful and very well-decorated. We liked the tropical plantation theme. Hyatt knows how to do it right. We spent a lot of time on the large spacious lanai/patio. It also had excellent comfortable patio furniture, not resin stuff. We had a great ocean view room. We had good service. Because of the way we booked the room (different rates and different reservation systems), we were told that we were going to have to change rooms midstay. But when we got there, the manager had already taken care of it, and we were able to keep the same room the entire stay! that made my day. The "endless" pool was fun and beautiful. Nice ocean view from the pool and spa. For the people who complain about the lack of service, I must comment that The Hyatt Winward Pointe is NOT a full service Hyatt hotel - it is a timeshare type of property. It is intended for extended (weekly) stays, and is basically self service, which is why it has a kitchen in the suite. Almost all "vacation condo resorts" are like this, and one should not be disappointed, as it is intentionally set up this way. Considering the Keys did not have any great beaches, we made the best of it at this resort, and had wonderful Thanksgiving with our family on this island. Although we won't be returning to Key West, we do highly recommend those coming for the first time, and repeat visitors, do consider this property if you are coming with family.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED HYATT WINDWARD POINTE RESORT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location - Ocean is right across the street! Took great walks on evenings by ocean. There's a beautiful beach and tennis courts a few minutes away by car. The Hyatt's pool and hot tub was great, also. landscape kept nice. The eating area by pool Abbey Road made great hotdogs! My husband and I really enjoyed our stay and going to town was so easy (by car). All shopping and restaurants are close by (with car) also. Can't wait for my next vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: klavr
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Ft. Lauderdale, FL and have visited Key West many times. Usually I would stay at an inexpensive hotel, but this time was different, and I will never stay anywhere else. It was great, well worth the price. They have so much to do at the hotel, that you don't have to leave if you don't want to. I highly recommend you staying here, especially if you have a group of people. The pictures on the website, is what the it actually looks like. Its Great!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rottn
Reviews.Content: After a terrible stay at Clarion Maingate in Kissimmee (see review) we rolled up to the Hyatt in Keywest and were greeted with a very nice lobby that definitely told me we were in vacation wonderland. The front desk was very accommodating with my request of an ocean front view. I was traveling with my 19 and 22 year daughters and we were all astounded at the sight of the room. It was the most incredible suite we had ever stayed in. We had decided that it will likely be hard to leave the room but rather we wanted to spend 3 days at the resort and not go out!! This of course did not happen but it was tempting. The furnishings were very elegant. The suite, which consisted of living room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms and two bedrooms, was as large as my condo... over 1000 sq. feet. The master bedroom had a huge bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub.. double sinks... separate little toilet room and yet another for a stand up shower. A telescope was also appreciated to view the ocean and the stars. It was so nice to wake up in my bed and look out across the ocean. I would highly recommend this vacation property. Yes, it was next to the airport.. but the quality of the building and the thick glass windows provided any protection from noise. Besides that it is not that busy of an airport. I really did not plan on coming back to Key West as there are so many places to see in the world but I was so impressed with the hotel and Key West that I am sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: designs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay at the Hyatt very much and thought the condo was beautifully decorated and was in wonderful condition and was thoroughly cleaned. It was great feeling coming through the door to a very clean and spotless place to stay. I also appreciated having the washer/dryer combo placed there within the room, it came in very handy. We also enjoyed the balcony and thought the size of it was perfect and thought the fan outside was a nice touch to cool things down abit. The view was wonderful overlooking the water and poolside. The staff was very polite and helpful and when we experienced a small problem they came right away to fix it without incident. Excellent job from the Hyatt from top to bottom. Although the beach situation was a disappointment for us there at the Keys the pool made it a lot nicer to deal with. I do think they could extend the pool use hours longer though maybe until midnight. Everything there was top notch and I would recommend staying there. Don't let the airport keep you away, the noise level was very minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path...no beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the Hyatt. The condo was beautiful! It overlooked the ocean; however, guests could not get to the ocean to go for a swim. No beach for the guests. The pool was large and beautiful. It was quite a distance from Duval and Mallory Square. The airport did not bother us, however it is closer than you would think.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the room...”
Reviews.Author: BoogRock
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is all about the room. Wonderful floorplan, beautifully decorated, most luxurious bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel room, ultra-comfortable beds, and a fully equipped kitchen. However, my favorite part of the experience was definitely the HUGE balcony with awesome views, wicker rockers, full-size kitchen table, and a telescope. I think we spent 90% of our time out there. The pool was the best I saw in any of the Key West hotels, and the grounds were extremely well kept and lush. The location close to the airport was definitely an issue, but if your kids and/or husband love to watch planes take off and land as much as mine do, this is a plus rather than a minus. The actual location of the resort is convenient, as it is relatively close to all major supermarkets and stores, although a car is a must if you are staying here. You can walk to Benihanas and Marthas (both high-end dinner restaurants) and Smather's Beach, but not much else. There is a snack bar on-site that is only open for lunch. However, this facility is not for those who are looking for a full-service hotel. The staff, although friendly, were little help in helping us retrieve our lost luggage from the airline, nor was there a concierge to help with tours and restaurant information, and there is no in-room high-speed internet connection. And, worst of all, there is no gym. MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT, which may prevent a return stay for us, was the sheer number of timeshare sales tours that occurred here on a daily basis. Although we weren't in the room much, we were close to the models, so each time we entered and exited the room, we were almost run over by abrupt sales agents and their customers. If you are staying here as a hotel guest rather than as a prospective or current timeshare customer, suggest a room away from the sales activity (although those rooms do have the nicest views). It will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at the Hyatt Windward and it was a great experience. We arrived late because our flight was cancelled and we had to wait in the Miami airport for 6 hours to get another flight (grrh). Needless to say we were not happy, but when we got to the hotel and opened the door we knew that even though we had an awful time getting to Key West the Hyatt made everything better. The room was beautiful and had everything that we need to kick back and relax. We had a view of the ocean and we sat on the balcony every morning drinking coffee and every evening having dinner. Although, the Hyatt is right by the airport there were no flights in the middle of the night and we did not hear the first planes leaving until maybe 8 or 9am in the morning. The hotel is on the other side of the island and away from Duval Street, but if you are looking for relaxation and that is it then Hyatt Windward Pointe is for you. Plus Parasailing is only down the road and it was so much fun! We had a great time and look forward going back year after year.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Windward Pointe
HotelInfo.Address: 3675 S Roosevelt Blvd, Key West, FL 33040
